5217547 5219757 I'm not so sure
what he'd think about it.
5578157 5580201 Prepare G-pod for EVA, Hal.
5583287 5584622 Any contact with him yet?
5584872 5586666 The radio is still dead.
5586874 5589794 - Do you have a positive track on him? - I have a good track.
5590044 5591462 Do you know what happened?
5591754 5594423 I'm sorry, Dave. I don't have enough information.
5594674 5596259 Open the pod door, Hal.
6040160 6042538 Open the pod-bay doors, please, Hal.
6050462 6052756 Open the pod-bay doors, please, Hal.
6058387 6060264 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
6063600 6065477 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
6066520 6068188 Do you read me, Hal?
6071358 6072985 Do you read me, Hal?
6075487 6077364 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
6079283 6081326 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
6081744 6083245 Do you read me, Hal?
6083495 6086248 Affirmative, Dave. I read you.
6089543 6091378 Open the pod-bay doors, Hal.
6092963 6096508 I'm sorry, Dave. I'm afraid I can't do that.
6098927 6100721 What's the problem?
6101138 6104349 I think you know what the problem is just as well as I do.
6104558 6106435 What are you talking about, Hal?
6107436 6111523 This mission is too important for me to allow you to jeopardize it.

6112608 6114985 I don't know
what you're talking about, Hal.
6116987 6120949 I know that you and Frank were planning to disconnect me...
6121158 6123952 ...and that's something I cannot allow to happen.
6129249 6131126 Where did you get that idea, Hal?
6131668 6135798 Although you took very thorough precautions in the pod...
6136048 6138258 ...against my hearing you...
6138675 6140969 ...I could see your lips move.
6153023 6154525 All right, Hal.

6157736 6160572 I'll go in through
the emergency air lock.
6162115 6164743 Without your space helmet, Dave...
6165244 6167704 ...you're going to find that rather difficult.
6168872 6170999 Hal, I won't argue with you anymore.
6171250 6172334 Open the doors.
6174795 6179258 ...this conversation can serve no purpose anymore. Goodbye.
6589125 6592379 Just what do you think you're doing, Dave?
6603390 6607811 ...I really think I'm entitled to an answer to that question.
6624703 6628248 I know everything hasn't been quite right with me...
6630208 6632627 ...but I can assure you now...
6633712 6635755 ...very confidently...
6637507 6640552 ...that it's going to be all right again.
6644055 6646141 I feel much better now.
6657944 6661197 ...I can see you're really upset about this.
6665827 6669539 I honestly think you ought to sit down calmly...
6670165 6673501 ...take a stress pill and think things over.
6678923 6683303 I know I've made some very poor decisions recently...
6686056 6689392 ...but I can give you my complete assurance...
6689642 6692687 ...that my work will be back to normal.
6696649 6701780 I've still got the greatest enthusiasm and confidence in the mission...
6703323 6705617 ...and I want to help you.
6730934 6733353 Will you stop, Dave?
6765301 6767554 My mind is going.
6785071 6787157 My mind is going.
6792537 6795290 There is no question about it.
6835371 6837415 Good afternoon...
6842003 6847133 I am a HAL 9000 computer.
6849302 6852430 I became operational...
6856851 6859103 ...in Urbana, Illinois...
6866069 6869739 My instructor was Mr. Langley...
6870365 6873284 ...and he taught me to sing a song.
6874994 6877455 If you'd like to hear it...
6877914 6879582 ...I can sing it for you.
6881084 6883920 Yes, I'd like to hear it, Hal.
6884587 6886005 Sing it for me.
6887257 6890802 It's called "Daisy."
6899143 6902230 Give me your answer, do
6911030 6913908 All for the love of you
6917870 6920331 A stylish marriage
6922250 6926337 I can't afford a carriage
6928631 6931050 But you'll look sweet
6931926 6934470 Upon the seat
6935805 6940602 Of a bicycle built for two
6942353 6943980 Good day, gentlemen.
6948610 6951070 This is a prerecorded briefing...
6951654 6953364 ...made prior to your departure...
6955116 6959329 ...and which, for security reasons of the highest importance...
6960288 6963791 ...has been known on board during the mission...
6964042 6967754 ...only by your HAL 9000 computer.
6970214 6973009 Now that you are in Jupiter's space...
6973259 6975720 ...and the entire crew is revived...
6975970 6977764 ...it can be told to you.
6980516 6982769 Eighteen months ago...
6983770 6987982 ...the first evidence of intelligent life off the Earth...
6991527 6995073 It was buried 40 feet below the lunar surface...
6995323 6997575 ...near the crater Tycho.
7000370 7003456 Except for a single, very powerful...
7003706 7007585 ...radio emission aimed at Jupiter...
7008836 7013841 ...the 4-million-year-old monolith has remained completely inert...
7015760 7018846 ...its origin and purpose...
7019263 7021015 ...still a total mystery.

subtitles.author: Echelon17
lines: 1544100 1546478 Here you are, sir. Main level, please.
1547437 1549272 Right. See you on the way back.

1552067 1553610 -Good morning, sir.
-Good morning.

1553651 1555654 We haven't seen you up here
for a long time.
1555696 1557072 No. Very nice to see you again.

1557155 1559991 -Did you have a pleasant flight, sir?
-Yes, very nice, thanks.

1560032 1563245 I think Mr. Miller of Station Security
is supposed to be meeting me.
1563328 1564328 May I call him for you?
1564411 1565580 Would you, please? Here he is!

1565664 1567624 -Hello, Dr. Floyd.
-Hello, Miller! How are you?

1567665 1569917 -Sorry I'm late.
-That's all right. You look great.
1570002 1571836 Thank you. It's nice to have you back.

1571878 1574255 -Did you have a good flight?
-Very nice indeed.

1574339 1575799 -Well, shall we go through?
-Okay.
1575841 1577342 Will you please use Number 17?

1577383 1579178 -Thank you, Miss Turner.
-Thank you.
1585641 1587893 Welcome to Voice Print Identification.
1588145 1590063 When you see the red light go on...

1590146 1592607 ...would you please state
in the following order.:

1592691 1596528 your destination, your nationality
and your full name.
1596987 1599823 Surname first, Christian name and initial.
1601533 1605496 Moon. American. Floyd, Heywood R.

1608207 1612170 Thank you. You are cleared through
Voice Print Identification.
1620929 1622597 Have I got time for breakfast?
1622680 1624139 I think we can manage that.
1624222 1625432 How long have I got?

1625516 1628143 Your flight leaves
in an hour and ten minutes.

1628227 1631189 I've reserved a table for you
in the Earthlight Room.

1631855 1635359 It's been about seven or eight months
since you were here last, isn't it?
1635443 1637153 Let's see. Yeah, about eight months.

1637237 1640531 I suppose you saw the work on
the new section when you came in here?

1640573 1642908 -Yes, coming along great, huh?
-Yeah, it's fine.
1642991 1644077 Oh, wait a minute!

1644160 1647580 I've got a few calls to make.
I'll meet you in the restaurant.

1665765 1668601 Will Mr. Travers please contact
the Met Office?

1669853 1672772 Will Mr. Travers please contact
the Met Office?

1680112 1681906 -How are you, squirt?
-All right.
1681948 1683450 What are you doin'?
1686285 1687537 Where's Mommy?
1688038 1689456 Gone to shopping.

1689748 1692083 -Well, who's taking care of ya?
-Rachel.
1692417 1694085 May I speak to Rachel, please?
1694127 1695920 She's gone to the bathroom.
1696046 1698464 Are you coming to my party tomorrow?
1699007 1701218 I'm sorry, sweetheart, but I can't.
1703303 1705722 Well, you know, Daddy's traveling.
1706014 1708392 Very sorry about it, but I just can't!

1709809 1712645 I'm gonna send you
a very nice present, though.

1715441 1717776 -Anything special that you want?
- Yes.
1719278 1720404 A telephone.
1721363 1723364 We've got lots of telephones already.

1723448 1726201 Can't you think of anything else
you want for your birthday?
1726284 1727744 Something very special?

1731331 1733875 A bush baby?
Well, we'll have to see about that.

1733958 1735919 I want you to tell Mommy
something for me.

1736002 1737881 -Will you remember?
- Yes.
1738214 1740675 Well, tell Mommy that I telephoned. Okay?

1742677 1745305 And that I'll try
to telephone again tomorrow.
1745764 1747556 Now, will you tell her that?

1749599 1752520 Okay, sweetheart.
Now, have a nice birthday tomorrow.

1754021 1756856 And have a nice birthday party
tomorrow, too, huh?

1759026 1761903 Okay, now, take care and be a good girl,
won't you?
1761987 1763322 All right. Bye-bye!
1763364 1765950 Bye-bye! Happy birthday.
1779630 1781841 Elena, how nice to see you again.

1781883 1784009 What a wonderful surprise
to meet you here!

1784051 1787138 -You're looking wonderful.
-Thank you. You're looking well, too.
1787222 1789390 This is my good friend, Dr. Heywood Floyd.

1789474 1791935 -I'd like you to meet Dr. Kalinan.
-How do you do?

1792018 1794145 -Dr. Stretyneva.
-How do you do?
1794229 1796064 And this is Dr. Andrei Smyslov.
1796147 1798775 How do you do? I've heard a lot about you.
1798858 1800318 Won't you sit down?

1800736 1802571 -Well, we--
-No, no, please.
1803113 1804572 Well, thank you.

1804863 1807867 -Would you like a drink, Doctor?
-No, thank you.

1807950 1811246 I haven't had breakfast yet.
Someone's meeting me in the restaurant.

1811330 1814207 I'll just sit with you a few minutes
and then I must be off.

1814248 1817294 -Are you quite sure?
-I'm quite sure, thank you.

1817920 1820046 -And how's Gregor?
-He's fine.

1820422 1823759 He's been doing some underwater research
in the Baltic so...

1823926 1828055 ...I'm afraid we don't get a chance
to see very much of each other these days.

1828096 1830223 When you do see him,
give him my regards, huh?
1830265 1831767 Yes, of course.

1832142 1834728 Well, where are you all off to?
Up or down?
1834853 1836396 Oh, we're going home.

1836563 1840775 We have just spent three months
calibrating the new antennae at Tchalinko.

1841652 1844487 -And what about you?
-I'm just on my way up to Clavius.

1848575 1851870 Dr. Floyd, I hope you don't think
I'm being too inquisitive, but...

1851954 1854457 ...perhaps you can clear up
the great big mystery...
1854540 1856751 ...about what is going on up there.
1858128 1860087 I'm afraid I don't know what you mean.
1860128 1862256 Oh, it's just that for the past two weeks...

1862297 1865634 ...some extremely odd things
have been happening at Clavius.

1865968 1867636 -Oh, really?
-Yes, yes.

1868304 1872641 For one thing, whenever you phone
the base all you get is a recording which...

1872850 1876979 ...repeats that the phone lines
are temporarily out of order.

1878565 1882276 Probably having some trouble with
their equipment or something like that.

1882359 1884946 That's what we thought
was the explanation at first...

1884987 1887572 ...but it has been going on now
for the past ten days.

1887656 1890659 You have not been able to contact anyone
for the past ten days?
1893204 1894830 And there's another thing, Heywood.

1894913 1897916 Two days ago, one of our rocket buses
was denied permission...
1898000 1900294 ...for an emergency landing at Clavius.
1900377 1901671 That does sound odd.

1901754 1905133 Yes, yes. I'm afraid there's going to be
a bit of a row about that.

1905175 1909137 Denying the men permission to land is
a direct violation of the I.A.S. Convention.
1909220 1911014 Yes, of course. Of course.

1911055 1913932 -Did the crew get back all right?
-Yes, fortunately they did.
1914015 1915893 Well, I'm glad about that.

1919354 1923318 At the risk of pressing you
on a point you seem reticent to discuss...

1923650 1926237 ...may I ask you
a straightforward question?
1926446 1927780 Well, certainly.

1930617 1934663 Quite frankly, we have had some
very reliable intelligence reports that...

1935163 1938375 ...quite a serious epidemic
has broken out on Clavius.

1938876 1941627 Something, apparently,
of an unknown origin.
1943004 1945298 Is this, in fact, what has happened?
1950720 1952680 I'm sorry, Dr. Smyslov, but...
1954224 1956893 ...I'm really not at liberty to discuss this.
1958561 1959771 I understand.

1960814 1964276 But this epidemic could quite easily
spread to our base.
1964485 1966737 We should be given all the facts, Dr. Floyd.
1971616 1974202 As I said, I'm not at liberty to discuss it.

1977373 1980459 Now, are you sure you won't
change your mind about that drink?

1980542 1982669 No, I'm positive.
Now, I really must be going.

1982753 1986173 I hope that you and your wife can come
to the I.A.C. Conference in June.
1986256 1987884 We're gonna try. Hope we can make it.

1987967 1991553 And if you do, you remember to bring
that darling little daughter with you!

1991595 1995057 Well, that will all depend on
school vacations and all that sort of thing.
1995099 1996057 But if we can, we will.

1996099 1999686 Don't forget you have a standing invitation
if you ever get to the States.

1999769 2002773 No, of course not. Gregor and I will
look forward to seeing you.
2002856 2004442 Well, goodbye, Elena.

2004941 2007861 It has been a pleasure meeting you all,
Dr. Smyslov.

2007945 2011908 Whatever the reasons for your visit
to Clavius, the very best of luck to you.
2490100 2491560 Excuse me, Dr. Halvorsen.

2491602 2493854 I'm through now.
Thank you very much, gentlemen.
2493937 2495063 You're welcome.

2509954 2514375 I know you will all want to join with me
in welcoming our...
2515168 2517252 ...distinguished friend and colleague...

2517294 2521131 ...from the National Council
of Astronautics, Dr. Heywood Floyd.

2521757 2526470 Dr. Floyd has come up specially to Calvius
to be with us today.

2527972 2531475 And before the briefing I know
he'd like to have a few words with you.
2545615 2547783 Thank you, Dr. Halvorsen.
2547824 2549160 Hi, everybody.
2549327 2551287 Nice to be back again.

2553998 2557460 First of all, I bring a personal message
from Dr. Howell who...

2557627 2560881 ...has asked me to convey
his deepest appreciation to all of you...

2560964 2563842 ...for the many sacrifices
you have had to make.

2564133 2567430 And, of course, his congratulations
on your discovery...

2568513 2572976 ...which may well prove to be among the
most significant in the history of science.

2577356 2581192 ...I know there have been some
conflicting views held by some of you...

2581526 2584821 ...regarding the need
for complete security in this matter.

2585363 2588617 More specifically, your opposition
to the cover story...

2589576 2593539 ...created to give the impression
that there is an epidemic at the base.

2594164 2597418 I understand that beyond it being
a matter of principle...

2598585 2602297 ...many of you are troubled
by the concern and anxiety...

2602380 2606760 ...this story of an epidemic might cause
to your relatives and friends on Earth.

2607719 2610889 Well, I completely sympathize
with your negative views.

2612683 2615728 I find this cover story
personally embarrassing myself.

2617147 2620900 However, I accept the need
for absolute secrecy in this.
2622235 2624070 And I hope you will, too.

2626571 2629742 Now, I'm sure you are all aware
of the extremely grave potential...

2629825 2632495 ...for cultural shock
and social disorientation...
2632578 2634705 ...contained in this present situation...

2634747 2637750 ...if the facts were prematurely
and suddenly made public...

2637792 2640586 ...without adequate preparation
and conditioning.
2642547 2644924 Anyway, this is the view of the Council.

2646383 2650388 The purpose of my visit here is
to gather additional facts and opinions...
2650597 2652140 ...on the situation...
2652932 2655518 ...and to prepare a report to the Council...
2656101 2658062 ...recommending when and how...

2659146 2661649 ...the news should eventually
be announced.

2662441 2666154 Now, if any of you would like to give me
your views and opinions...

2666446 2670784 ...in private if you like, I will be only
too happy to include them in my report.
2673411 2675330 Well, I think that's about it.
2676164 2677540 Any questions?

2680293 2684505 Dr. Floyd, have you any idea
how much longer this cover story...
2684589 2686549 ...will have to be maintained?
2688300 2689761 I don't know, Bill.

2690303 2694099 I suppose it will be maintained as long as
is deemed necessary by the Council.

2694140 2697727 There must be adequate time for
a full study to be made on the situation...

2697812 2701189 ...before any thought can be given
to making a public announcement.

2701272 2704484 Oh, yes, as some of you already know,
the Council has requested...

2704567 2707488 ...that formal security oaths are
to be obtained in writing...

2707530 2710323 ...from everyone who has any knowledge
of this event.
2712366 2714493 Are there any more questions?

2719916 2724587 I'm sure we all want to cooperate
with Dr. Floyd as fully as possible...

2725923 2728634 ...and as there seems
to be no more questions...

2728927 2731053 ...I think we ought to get on
with the briefing.

2731136 2733597 -Thank you, Dr. Floyd.
-Thank you.
2830946 2832447 Anybody hungry?

2834950 2836910 -What we've got?
-You name it.

2841374 2843626 -What's this? Chicken?
-Something like that.
2843709 2845251 Tastes the same, anyway.

2854302 2858390 -Looks pretty good.
-They're getting better at it all the time.

2860142 2862395 That was an excellent speech
you gave us, Heywood.
2862478 2863646 It certainly was.
2864272 2866357 I'm sure it beefed up morale a hell of a lot.
2866440 2867609 Thanks, Ralph.

2867650 2870986 I want to say to both of you
that I think you've done a wonderful job.

2871070 2872988 I appreciate the way
you've handled this thing.

2873029 2876909 Well, the way we look at it, it's our job
to do this thing the way you want it done.

2876992 2879285 And we're only too happy
to be able to oblige.
2879828 2881413 Have you seen these yet?
2881496 2882832 Take a look at them.
2882915 2885209 Here's what started the whole thing.

2887378 2891174 When we first found it, we thought
it might be an outcrop of magnetic rock...

2891215 2894468 ...but all the geological evidence
was against it.

2894551 2899223 And not even a big nickel iron meteorite
could produce a field as intense as this.
2899516 2900932 So, we decided to have a look.

2901017 2904019 We thought it might be
the upper part of some buried structure...
2904103 2905687 ...so we excavated out on all sides.

2905771 2907982 But, unfortunately,
we didn't find anything else.

2908065 2911110 And what's more, the evidence seems
pretty conclusive that...

2911193 2914447 ...it has not been covered up
by natural erosion or other forces.
2914530 2917366 It seems to have been deliberately buried.
2917867 2919328 Deliberately buried.
2923498 2924917 How about a little coffee?

2925000 2927251 -Great.
-Good idea.

2932632 2935676 I don't suppose you have any idea
what the damn thing is, huh?
2935718 2937595 I wish to hell we did.

2938220 2942225 No, the only thing we're sure of is
it was buried four million years ago.

2942767 2946855 Well, I must say, you guys have certainly
come up with something.
3533698 3534950 Good evening.

3535159 3538287 Three weeks ago, the American spacecraft,
Discovery One...

3538329 3541248 ...left on its half-billion mile voyage
to Jupiter.

3541331 3544961 This marked the first manned attempt
to reach this distant planet.

3545420 3548756 Earlier this afternoon, "The World Tonight"
recorded an interview...

3548840 3553053 ...with the crew of Discovery at a distance
of80 million miles from Earth.

3553637 3557265 It took seven minutes for our words
to reach the giant spacecraft...

3557348 3560643 ...but this time delay has been edited
from this recording.

3560685 3563396 Our reporter, Martin Amer,
speaks to the crew.

3564313 3567191 The crew of Discovery One
consists of five men...

3567567 3572029 ...and one of the latest generation
of the HAL-9000 computers.

3572822 3575200 Three of the five men
were put aboard asleep...

3575242 3578203 ...or to be more precise,
in a state of hibernation.

3578662 3583333 They were Dr. Charles Hunter,
Dr. Jack Kimballand Dr. Victor Kaminsky.

3584168 3587003 We spoke with Mission Commander,
Dr. David Bowman...
3587045 3589380 ...and his deputy, Dr. Frank Poole.

3589547 3592551 Well, good afternoon, gentlemen.
How is everything going?

3592593 3596429 Marvellous. We have no...
we have no complaints.

3597389 3600850 Well, I'm very glad to hear that
and I'm sure that the entire world...

3600892 3604355 ...would join me in wishing you
a safe and successful voyage.

3604479 3606481 - Thanks very much.
- Thank you.

3606648 3610444 Although hibernation has been used
on previous space efforts...

3610737 3615198 ...this is the first time that men have been
put into hibernation before departure.
3615240 3616616 Why was this done?

3617075 3620495 Well, this was done in order to achieve
the maximum conservation...

3620579 3623958 ...of our life-support capabilities,
basically food and air.

3624249 3627878 Now, the three hibernating crew members
represent the survey team.

3628212 3631925 And their efforts won't be utilized
until we are approaching Jupiter.

3632174 3635470 Dr. Poole, what's it like
while you are in hibernation?

3637055 3640724 It's exactly like being asleep;
you have absolutely no sense of time.
3640765 3643226 The only difference is you don't dream.

3643477 3646188 As I understand it,
you only breathe once a minute.
3646271 3647440 Is this true?

3648565 3652319 And your heart beats three times a minute,
body temperature is usually down...
3652403 3654739 ...to about three degrees centigrade.

3654780 3658283 The sixth member of the Discovery crew
was not concerned...
3658367 3660621 ...about the problems of hibernation.

3660703 3663748 For he was the latest result
in machine intelligence.

3664332 3668710 The HAL-9000 computer
which can reproduce...

3669128 3672130 ...though some experts still prefer
to use the word "mimic"...

3672214 3677136 ...most of the activities of the human brain
and with incalculably greater speed...
3677219 3678638 ...and reliability.

3678971 3682600 We next spoke
with the HAL-9000 computer...
3682809 3685604 ...whom, we learned, one addresses as Hal.

3686480 3688858 Good afternoon, Hal.
How's everything going?

3688941 3692611 Good afternoon, Mr. Amer.
Everything's going extremely well.

3693070 3695864 Hal, you have an enormous responsibility
on this mission.

3695947 3698449 In many ways,
perhaps the greatest responsibility...
3698532 3700618 ...of any single mission element.

3700785 3703747 You are the brain
and central nervous system of the ship.

3703830 3707709 Your responsibilities include
watching over the men in hibernation.

3707792 3710670 Does this ever cause you
any lack of confidence?
3711087 3713215 Let me put it this way, Mr. Amer.

3713674 3717636 The 9000 Series is
the most reliable computer ever made.

3718720 3723100 No 9000 computer has ever made
a mistake or distorted information.

3724184 3727312 We are all by any practical definition
of the words...
3727688 3730482 ...fool proof and incapable of error.

3731274 3735279 Hal, despite your enormous intellect,
are you ever frustrated...

3735362 3738323 ...by your dependence on people
to carry out actions?
3738699 3740410 Not in the slightest bit.
3741160 3742954 I enjoy working with people.

3743495 3747500 I have a stimulating relationship
with Dr. Poole and Dr. Bowman.

3748209 3752629 My mission responsibilities range
over the entire operation of the ship...
3752962 3754964 ...so lam constantly occupied.

3756049 3759136 I am putting myself
to the fullest possible use...

3759720 3764350 ...which is all, I think, that
any conscious entity can ever hope to do.

3765100 3768479 Dr. Poole, what's it like living
for the better part of a year...
3768562 3770689 ...in such close proximity with Hal?

3772149 3774569 It's pretty close to what you said
about him earlier.

3774610 3776779 He's just like the sixth member
of the crew.

3776862 3781032 You very quickly get adjusted to the idea
that he talks. You think of him...
3781241 3783368 ...really as just another person.

3783410 3787206 In talking to the computer
one gets the sense that he is capable...
3787248 3788749 ...of emotional response.

3788791 3791293 For example, when I asked him
about his abilities...

3791377 3795465 ...I sensed a certain pride in his answer
about his accuracy and perfection.

3795757 3798510 Do you believe that Hal
has genuine emotions?

3799928 3802847 Oh, yes. Well, he acts
like he has genuine emotions.

3803056 3806767 Of course, he's programmed that way
to make it easier for us to talk to him.

3806851 3809104 But, as to whether or not
he has real feelings...

3809187 3812440 ...is something I don't think anyone
can truthfully answer.
3837257 3838633 Excuse me, Frank.
3839551 3840677 What is it, Hal?

3840760 3843805 We've got the transmission
from your parents coming in.
3846683 3849144 Put it on here, please. Take me in a bit.

3863576 3865285 -Hello, Frank.
-Happy birthday, darling.

3865368 3867620 Happy birthday.
Many happy returns of the day.
3867704 3869206 A bit higher, please.

3869289 3871500 Now, Mother and I are both
feeling wonderful, too.
3871584 3873585 Ray and Sally were going to be here, too...

3873669 3876422 ...but at the last minute
Ray's back went bad on him again.
3876505 3877964 How do you like your cake, dear?

3878007 3880509 Looks great, doesn't it?
Sorry you can't be with us.
3880551 3882053 Oh, I ran into Bob the other day.

3882137 3884305 He said to be sure
and wish you a happy birthday.

3884389 3887349 All my students made me promise
to send their best wishes, too.

3887391 3889977 You know they talk about you
all the time in the classroom.
3890060 3892521 You're a big celebrity in the second grade.

3892604 3894356 You know we were on television
last week?

3894439 3897610 Oh, yes! Your mother and I
and Dave's parents were interviewed...

3897693 3899820 ...about what we thought of
our illustrious son.

3899863 3903490 You can imagine what we told them.
I think it's being broadcast next Thursday.
3903574 3905159 Perhaps you'll be able to listen in.

3905326 3907496 Oh, we were thrilled
about Elaine and Bill, dear.

3907537 3911416 I'll be glad to get the present for you,
but please tell me how much to spend.

3911499 3914126 Oh, yes, Frank,
about yourAGS-19payments--
3914209 3915878 I think I straightened it out for you.

3915962 3918589 I talked to the Accounting Office
in Houston yesterday...

3918673 3922676 ...and they said you should be receiving
your higher rates of pay by next month.
3923386 3925680 Well, I can't think of anything else to say.

3925722 3929184 -Oh, our love to Dave.
-Be sure to give him our best regards.

3930142 3932854 We wish you the very happiest
of birthdays.
3933730 3935106 All the best, son.
3947452 3949078 See you next Wednesday.
3952582 3954209 Happy birthday, Frank.
3955293 3957671 Thank you, Hal. A bit flatter, please.
3976815 3978775 Anyway, queen takes pawn--
3980611 3982404 Bishop takes knight's pawn.
3992289 3994750 I'm sorry, Frank. I think you missed it.

3995834 3998795 Queen to bishop, three.
Bishop takes queen.
3999588 4001590 Knight takes bishop. Mate.
4006345 4008847 Looks like you're right. Very good.
4009723 4011726 Thank you for a very enjoyable game.

4050890 4053017 -Good evening, Dave.
-How are you doing, Hal?

4053101 4056479 -Everything's running smoothly. And you?
-Oh, not too bad.

4056521 4059524 -Have you been doing some more work?
-A few sketches.

4059649 4061359 -May I see them?
-Sure.
4066072 4068241 That's a very nice rendering, Dave.
4069410 4071662 I think you've improved a great deal.

4073079 4075332 -Can you hold it a bit closer?
-Sure.
4078208 4080294 That's Dr. Hunter, isn't it?

4085801 4088387 Do you mind
if I ask you a personal question?
4089388 4090848 No, no. Not at all.
4091180 4094100 Well, forgive me for being so inquisitive...

4095560 4097980 ...but during the past few weeks
I've wondered...

4098064 4102026 ...whether you might have been having
some second thoughts about the mission?
4102067 4103444 How do you mean?
4105361 4107364 It's rather difficult to define.

4108991 4112034 Perhaps I'm just projecting
my own concern about it.

4113746 4117373 I know I've never completely freed myself
of the suspicion...

4118249 4121712 ...that there are some extremely
odd things about this mission.

4123380 4126592 I'm sure you will agree there is some truth
in what I say.

4129429 4132181 I don't know.
That's a rather difficult question to answer.

4132264 4134892 You don't mind talking about it,
do you, Dave?
4135684 4137144 Oh, no, not at all.

4138479 4140730 Certainly no one could
have been unaware of...

4140773 4144068 ...the very strange stories floating around
before we left.

4145611 4148489 Rumours of something being dug up
on the Moon.
4150325 4152869 I never gave these stories much credence...

4153869 4157999 ...but particularly in view of some
of the other things that have happened...

4158166 4160876 ...I find them difficult
to put out of my mind.
4161627 4162920 For instance.:

4163296 4166923 The way all our preparations
were kept under such tight security...
4168176 4169760 ...and the melodramatic touch...

4169801 4173181 ...of putting Drs. Hunter, Kimball
and Kaminsky aboard...

4173974 4178227 ...already in hibernation after four months
of separate training on their own.

4179812 4182316 You working up
your crew psychology report?
4183942 4185318 Of course, lam.
4185736 4188779 Sorry about this. I know it's a bit silly.
4190238 4191491 Just a moment.
4192117 4193325 Just a moment.

4194995 4198456 I have just picked up a fault
in the AE-35 unit.

4200000 4203670 It's going to go 100percent failure
within 72hours.

4206506 4209134 -You are still within operational limits?
- Yes.
4209551 4211929 And it will stay that way until it fails.

4212012 4214472 Would you say we had a reliable 72 hours
until failure?
4214555 4217642 Yes. That's a completely reliable figure.

4220061 4223315 We'll have to bring it in,
but I'd like to go over this with Frank...

4223398 4227235 ...and get on to Mission Control.
Let me have a hard copy of it, please.
4309945 4312406 X-Ray Delta One, this is Mission Control.
4312905 4315158 Roger to your Two-zero-one-three.

4315992 4318537 Sorry you fellows are having
a bit of trouble.

4318620 4323207 We are reviewing telematic information
in our Mission Simulator and will advise.

4324041 4329297 Roger your plan to go EVA and replace
Alpha-Echo-35 unit prior to failure.
4358243 4360036 Prepare B pod for EVA, Hal.
4381851 4383560 Open the pod doors, Hal.

4795310 4798564 Well, Hal, I'm damned
if I can find anything wrong with it.

4804779 4808116 I don't think I've ever seen anything
quite like this before.
4812245 4813704 I would recommend...

4814456 4817876 ...that we put the unit back in operation
and let it fail.

4819335 4822588 It should then be a simple matter
to track down the cause.

4824340 4827301 We can certainly afford
to be out of communication...

4827803 4830597 ...for the short time it will take
to replace it.
4839647 4842151 X-Ray Delta One, this is Mission Control.
4842609 4844611 Roger your One-niner-three-zero.

4845486 4849700 We concur with your plan to replace
Number One unit to check fault prediction.

4850199 4852953 We should advise you, however,
that our preliminary findings...

4852994 4855997 ...indicate that your onboard
Niner-triple-zero computer...
4856038 4858249 ...is in error predicting the fault.
4858333 4860919 I say again, in error predicting the fault.

4861670 4866132 I know this sounds rather incredible,
but this conclusion is based on...

4866341 4869303 ...results from our twin
Niner-triple-zero computer.

4870012 4873391 We are sceptical ourselves and
we are running crosschecking routines...

4873474 4876184 ...to determine reliability
of this conclusion.
4876392 4878395 Sorry about this little snag, fellows.

4878478 4881315 We'll get this info to you
just as soon as we work it out.
4881356 4883859 X-Ray Delta One, this is Mission Control.

4883943 4886404 Two-zero-four-nine.
Transmission concluded.

4891451 4894329 I hope the two of you
are not concerned about this.
4896707 4898124 Are you quite sure?

4898542 4901502 -Yeah. I'd like to ask you a question.
-Of course.

4903087 4905172 How would you account for
the discrepancy...
4905214 4907174 ...between you and the twin 9000?

4907341 4910218 Well, I don't think there is
any question about it.
4911137 4914098 It can only be attributable to human error.
4915725 4918227 This sort of thing has cropped up before...

4918727 4921397 ...and it has always been due
to human error.

4927654 4930282 ...there's never been
any instance at all of...

4930365 4933533 ...a computer error occurring
in a 9000 Series, has there?
4933617 4935245 None whatsoever, Frank.

4935495 4938706 The 9000 Series
has a perfect operational record.

4939374 4943628 Of course, I know the wonderful
achievements of the 9000 Series, but....

4944629 4947633 Are you certain there's never been
any case of even the most...
4947716 4949718 ...insignificant computer error?
4950260 4951886 None whatsoever, Frank.

4952512 4955389 Quite honestly,
I wouldn't worry myself about that.
4960728 4962772 Well, I'm sure you're right, Hal.
4964399 4966234 Fine, thanks very much.

4970279 4972575 I'm having trouble
with my transmitter in C pod.

4972617 4975451 Would you come down
and take a look at it with me?
4975618 4976954 See ya later, Hal.
4998267 5000102 Rotate C pod, please, Hal.
5008944 5011155 What sort of trouble have you had, Dave?

5011238 5014033 I've been getting some interference
in D channel.
5014158 5015826 We'll have a look at it.
5021958 5023417 Open the door, Hal.
5042520 5044313 Rotate the pod, please, Hal.
5057661 5059663 Stop pod rotation, please, Hal.
5068171 5070006 Rotate the pod, please, Hal.
5073051 5074844 Rotate the pod, please, Hal.
5077096 5079016 I don't think he can hear us.
5079057 5080893 Rotate the pod, please, Hal!
5082644 5084397 Yeah, sure, we're okay.
5088024 5089401 What do you think?

5089819 5093529 -I'm not sure. What do you think?
-I've got a bad feeling about it.

5093738 5095532 -You do?
-Yeah. Definitely.
5098743 5100495 I don't know. I think so.

5101412 5105708 Of course, he's right about the 9000 Series
having a perfect operational record.

5106877 5110130 Unfortunately, that sounds
a little like famous last words.

5110798 5115136 Yeah. Still, it was his idea to carry out
the failure mode analysis, wasn't it?

5116387 5119681 It should certainly indicate his integrity
and self-confidence.

5119764 5122225 If he were wrong it would be
the surest way of proving it.
5122267 5124310 It would be if he knew he was wrong.

5126980 5131194 Look, Dave, I can't put my finger on it,
but I sense something strange about him.

5132778 5136282 I can't think of a good reason not
to put back the Number One unit and...

5136366 5139869 -...carry on with the failure mode analysis.
-No, no, I agree about that.
5140786 5141997 Let's get on with it.
5142080 5144249 Okay. But, look, Dave.

5145666 5148460 Let's say we put the unit back
and it doesn't fail, huh?

5148544 5152590 That would pretty well wrap it up
as far as Hal was concerned, wouldn't it?

5153382 5156844 -Well, we'd be in very serious trouble.
-We would, wouldn't we?
5157136 5158846 What the hell can we do?

5161849 5166312 -We wouldn't have too many alternatives.
-I don't think we'd have any alternatives.

5166645 5170734 There isn't a single aspect of ship
operation that's not under his control.
5170941 5172777 If he were proved to be malfunctioning...

5172818 5176112 ...I don't see how we would have
any choice but disconnection.
5179408 5181161 I'm afraid I agree with you.
5181244 5183163 There'd be nothing else to do.

5184747 5186582 -It'd be a bit tricky.
-Yeah.

5188001 5190629 We'd have to cut
his higher brain functions...

5190879 5194799 ...without disturbing the purely automatic
and regulatory systems.

5196635 5198846 We'd have to work out
the transfer procedures...

5198929 5202015 ...for continuing the mission
under ground-based computer control.

5202098 5206102 Yeah. That looks far safer than
allowing Hal to continue running things.

5207354 5209939 You know,
another thing just occurred to me.

5210690 5213568 As far as I know, no 9000 computer
has ever been disconnected.

5213651 5215862 Well, no 9000 computer
has ever fouled up before.
5215945 5217531 That's not what I mean.
5219659 5222119 I'm not so sure what he'd think about it.
5579981 5582068 Prepare B pod for EVA, Hal.
5585236 5586821 Made radio contact with him yet?
5586904 5588572 The radio is still dead.

5588865 5591993 -Do you have a positive track on him?
- Yes. I have a good track.
5592076 5593661 Do you know what happened?

5593744 5596539 I'm sorry, Dave.
I don't have enough information.
5596790 5598417 Open the pod door, Hal.
6042366 6044578 Open the pod bay doors, please, Hal.
6052626 6054838 Open the pod bay doors, please, Hal.
6060426 6062178 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
6065598 6067392 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
6068518 6070145 Do you read me, Hal?
6073355 6074817 Do you read me, Hal?
6077443 6079236 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
6081322 6083116 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
6083741 6085201 Do you read me, Hal?
6085535 6087954 Affirmative, Dave. I read you.
6091582 6093419 Open the pod bay doors, Hal.
6094919 6098298 I'm sorry, Dave. I'm afraid I can't do that.
6101010 6102469 What's the problem?

6103137 6106347 I think you know what the problem is
just as well as I do.
6106640 6108599 What are you talking about, Hal?

6109434 6113104 This mission is too important for me
to allow you to jeopardize it.

6114815 6117318 I don't know
what you're talking about, Hal.

6118986 6122240 I know that you and Frank
were planning to disconnect me...

6123323 6126619 ...and I'm afraid that's something
I cannot allow to happen.
6131248 6133749 Where the hell did you get that idea, Hal?

6134751 6137963 Although you took
very thorough precautions in the pod...
6138046 6139840 ...against my hearing you...
6140675 6142634 ...I could see your lips move.
6154980 6156232 All right, Hal.
6159777 6162279 I'll go in through the emergency air-lock.
6164157 6166242 Without your space helmet, Dave...
6167325 6169995 ...you're going to find that rather difficult.
6170871 6173123 Hal, I won't argue with you any more.
6173249 6174501 Open the doors!

6176794 6179840 This conversation can serve
no purpose any more.
6591131 6593925 Just what do you think you're doing, Dave?

6605394 6609233 I really think I'm entitled
to an answer to that question.

6626666 6629628 I know everything hasn't been
quite right with me...
6632213 6634132 ...but I can assure you now...
6635676 6637261 ... very confidently...
6639512 6642016 ...that it's going to be all right again.
6646020 6647729 I feel much better now.
6659993 6662745 ...I can see you're really upset about this.

6667834 6670753 I honestly think you ought
to sit down calmly...
6672130 6674716 ...take a stress pill and think things over.

6680930 6684725 I know I've made
some very poor decisions recently...

6688062 6690857 ...but I can give you
my complete assurance...
6691607 6694151 ...that my work will be back to normal.

6698532 6702994 I've still got the greatest enthusiasm
and confidence in the mission...
6705288 6707164 ...and I want to help you.
6720178 6722180 Stop, will you?
6732984 6734651 Will you stop, Dave?
6755256 6757216 I'm afraid, Dave.
6767308 6768686 My mind is going.
6774108 6775359 I can feel it.
6780989 6782367 I can feel it.
6787080 6788664 My mind is going.
6794545 6796630 There is no question about it.
6805682 6806974 I can feel it.
6812188 6813482 I can feel it.
6817484 6818820 I can feel it.
6837381 6838799 Good afternoon...
6844011 6848641 I am a HAL-9000 computer.
6851310 6853730 I became operational...
6858235 6860571 ...in Verbana, Illinois...
6868079 6870749 My instructor was Mr. Langley...
6872331 6874668 ...and he taught me to sing a song.
6877003 6878755 If you'd like to hear it...
6879923 6881592 ...I can sing it for you.
6883093 6885345 Yes, I'd like to hear it, Hal.
6886597 6887847 Sing it for me.
6889266 6891811 It's called "Daisy. "
6901194 6904156 "Give me your answer, do
6912790 6915876 "All for the love of you
6918213 6922551 "It won't be a stylish marriage
6924302 6928431 "I can't afford a carriage
6930683 6933144 "But you'll look sweet
6933895 6936606 "Upon the seat
6937815 6942486 "Of a bicycle made for two. "
6944322 6945990 Good day, gentlemen.
6950579 6952664 This is a pre-recorded briefing...
6953665 6955750 ...made prior to your departure...

6957210 6960963 ...and which for security reasons
of the highest importance...

6962257 6965010 ...has been known on board
during the mission...
6966010 6968638 ...only by your HAL-9000 computer.
6972183 6974477 Now that you are in Jupiter's space...
6975270 6977481 ...and the entire crew is revived...
6977857 6979566 ...it can be told to you.
6982485 6984028 Eighteen months ago...

6985989 6989533 ...the first evidence
of intelligent life off the Earth...
6990202 6991620 ...was discovered.

6993539 6996459 It was buried 40 feet
below the lunar surface...
6997334 6999128 ...near the crater "Tyco. "
7002297 7005051 Except for a single very powerful...
7005759 7008721 ...radio emission aimed at Jupiter...

7011056 7015477 ...the four-million-year-old black monolith
has remained completely inert.
7017896 7020398 Its origin and purpose...
7021400 7023277 ...are still a total mystery.

subtitles.author: scooby007
lines:
1544015 1546575 Here you are, sir.
Main level, please.
1547617 1549141 Right. See you on the way back.

1551823 1553791 Good morning, sir.
Morning.

1553958 1557018 - We haven't seen you for a long time.
- Nice to see you again.

1557261 1559660 - Did you have a pleasant flight?
- Very nice.

1559896 1562990 Mr. Miller of Station Security
is supposed to meet me.

1563200 1565691 - May I call him for you?
- Would you? Here he is.

1565936 1567267 - Hello, Dr. Floyd.
- Hello, Miller.

1567471 1569439 Sorry I'm late.
That's all right.
1569639 1571607 It's nice to have you back.

1571808 1574038 - Did you have a good flight?
- Very nice.

1574277 1577041 - Shall we go through?
- Would you please use number 17?

1577280 1580010 Thank you, Ms. Turner. This way.
Thank you.
1585554 1588045 Welcome to Voiceprint Identification.
1588324 1592420 When you see the red light go on, please state in the following order:
1592661 1596722 Your destination, your nationality and your full name.
1596999 1599797 Surname first, Christian name, and initial.
1601470 1605804 Moon. American. Floyd, Heywood R.
1608310 1611837 Thank you. You are cleared through Voiceprint Identification.

1620822 1623985 Have I got time for breakfast?
I think we can manage that.
1624192 1625250 How long have I got?

1625460 1627985 Your flight leaves
in an hour and 10 minutes.

1628163 1631599 I've reserved a table for you
in the Earthlight Room.

1631833 1635064 It's been seven or eight months
since you were here, hasn't it?
1635270 1637363 Let's see. Yeah, about eight months.

1637572 1640165 I suppose you saw the work
on the new section?

1640340 1642865 Coming along great, huh?
Yeah, it's fine.

1644244 1647907 I've got to make a couple calls.
I'll meet you in the restaurant.

1680046 1683447 Hi, squirt.
What are you doing?
1686219 1687652 Where's Mummy?
1687920 1689387 Gone to shopping.
1689622 1692090 - Who's taking care of you? - Rachel.
1692291 1695726 - May I speak to Rachel, please? - She's gone to the bathroom.
1695961 1698657 Are you coming to my party tomorrow?
1698930 1701330 I'm sorry, sweetheart, but I can't.
1703101 1705661 Well, you know, Daddy's traveling.
1706238 1708570 Very sorry about it, but I just can't.

1709674 1712734 I'm going to send you
a very nice present, though.
1715447 1717608 - Anything special that you want? - Yes.
1721253 1723413 We've got lots of telephones already.

1723621 1727955 Can't you think of anything else
for your birthday? Something special?

1731262 1733787 A bush baby?
We'll have to see about that.

1733998 1737764 I want you to tell Mummy
something for me. Will you remember?
1737968 1740937 Tell Mummy that I telephoned. Okay?

1742506 1745373 And that I'll try
to telephone again tomorrow.
1745643 1747577 Now, will you tell her that?

1749512 1752379 Okay, sweetheart.
Have a nice birthday tomorrow.

1753850 1756944 And have a nice birthday party
tomorrow too, huh?

1758955 1761583 Take care and be a good girl,
won't you?
1761824 1763018 All right. Bye-bye.
1763293 1765693 Bye-bye. Happy birthday.

1779474 1783808 Elena, nice to see you again.
Heywood, what a surprise.

1783979 1786971 You're looking wonderful.
You're looking well too.

1787149 1789174 This is my friend,
Dr. Heywood Floyd.

1789351 1791842 I'd like you to meet Dr. Kalinan.
How do you do?

1792020 1793885 Dr. Stretyneva.
How do you do?
1794056 1795853 And this is Dr. Andrei Smyslov.

1796024 1798424 How do you do?
I've heard a lot about you.

1800562 1802553 Well, we...
No, no, please.

1804632 1807658 Would you like a drink?
No, thank you.

1807835 1811168 I haven't had breakfast yet.
Someone's meeting me in the restaurant.

1811372 1813840 I'll just sit with you a moment.
Then I'll be off.

1814041 1816635 Are you quite sure?
Quite sure, thank you.

1817845 1820040 - Well, how's Gregor?
- He's fine.

1820281 1823580 He's been doing underwater research
in the Baltic...

1823851 1827878 ...so I'm afraid we don't see
very much of each other these days.

1828155 1831715 - When you see him, give him my regards.
- Yes, of course.

1831958 1834927 Well, where are you all off to?
Up or down?
1835161 1836185 We're going home.

1836396 1841265 We've spent three months calibrating
the new antenna at Tchalinko.

1841534 1844196 - What about you?
- I'm on my way to Clavius.

1848408 1851707 Dr. Floyd, I hope you don't think
I'm being too inquisitive...

1851911 1857042 ...but perhaps you can clear up the big
mystery about what is going on there.

1857817 1859943 I'm afraid I don't know
what you mean.
1860219 1861914 For the past two weeks...

1862121 1865557 ...some extremely odd things
have been happening at Clavius.

1865791 1867884 - Oh, really?
- Yes, yes.

1868193 1872459 For one thing, when you phone the base,
all you get is a recording...

1872698 1876828 ...which repeats that the phone lines
are temporarily out of order.

1878404 1880838 Probably having some trouble
with their equipment.

1882341 1887277 That's what we thought at first,
but it's been going on now for 10 days.

1887512 1890276 You haven't been able to
contact anyone for 10 days?

1893351 1897014 There's another thing.
Two days ago, one of our rocket buses...

1897255 1900156 ...was denied permission
for an emergency landing.
1900358 1901416 That does sound odd.

1901592 1904789 I'm afraid there's going to be
a bit of a row about it.

1905029 1908931 Denying the men permission to land
violates the IAS Convention.

1909133 1911966 Yes, of course.
Did the crew get back all right?

1912170 1915627 - Fortunately, they did.
- Well, I'm glad about that.

1919242 1923178 At the risk of pressing you on
a point you seem reticent to discuss...

1923447 1926007 ...may I ask you
a straightforward question?
1926249 1927682 Well, certainly.

1930454 1934788 Frankly, we have had some
very reliable intelligence reports that...

1935025 1938392 ...quite a serious epidemic
has broken out at Clavius.

1938662 1942654 Something, apparently,
of an unknown origin.
1942898 1945298 Is this, in fact, what has happened?
1950539 1952632 I'm sorry, Dr. Smyslov, but...

1954009 1956705 ...I'm really not at liberty
to discuss this.
1958347 1959507 I understand.

1960983 1964180 But this epidemic
could easily spread to our base.
1964386 1966479 We should be given all the facts.

1971526 1974552 As I said,
I'm not at liberty to discuss it.

1977365 1980163 Won't you change your mind
about that drink?

1980368 1982700 No, I'm positive.
I really must be going.

1982937 1985997 I hope you and your wife come
to the IAC Conference.
1986207 1987538 I hope we can make it.

1987742 1990802 If you do, bring that darling
little daughter with you.

1991012 1994914 That'll depend on school vacations
and all that sort of thing.
1995183 1996206 If we can, we will.

1996416 1999351 You've got an invitation
if you ever get to the States.

1999553 2002317 Gregor and I will look forward
to seeing you.
2003257 2004315 Goodbye, Elena.

2004725 2007592 It's been a pleasure meeting you all.
Dr. Smyslov.

2007828 2011764 Whatever the reasons for your visit,
the very best of luck to you.
2489691 2491522 Excuse me, Dr. Halvorsen.

2491693 2493991 I'm through now.
Thank you very much, gentlemen.
2494162 2495527 You're welcome.

2509845 2512609 ...I know you will all
want to join with me...

2512881 2516748 ...in welcoming our distinguished
friend and colleague...

2516951 2521183 ...from the National Council
of Astronautics, Dr. Heywood Floyd.

2521422 2526553 Dr. Floyd has come up specially
to Clavius to be with us today.

2527862 2531195 Before the briefing, he'd like
to have a few words with you.
2545412 2547380 Thank you, Dr. Halvorsen.

2547614 2550447 Hi, everybody.
Nice to be back with you.

2553753 2557348 First, I bring a personal message
from Dr. Howell...

2557590 2560388 ...who has asked me to convey
his deep appreciation...

2560627 2563721 ...for the many sacrifices
you've had to make.

2563963 2567797 And, of course, his congratulations
on your discovery...

2568368 2572963 ...which may prove to be among the most
significant in the history of science.

2577176 2581112 ...I know there have been some
conflicting views...

2581380 2584975 ...regarding the need for
complete security in this matter.

2585184 2588915 More specifically, your opposition
to the cover story...

2589321 2592882 ...created to give the impression
of an epidemic at the base.

2593926 2597885 I understand that beyond it being
a matter of principle...

2598496 2601954 ...many of you are troubled
by the concern and anxiety...

2602200 2607297 ...this story of an epidemic might cause
to your relatives and friends on Earth.

2608473 2611271 I completely sympathize
with your negative views.

2612543 2616206 I find this cover story
personally embarrassing, myself.

2617014 2621314 However, I accept the need
for absolute secrecy in this.
2622019 2623919 And I hope you will too.

2626523 2629356 I'm sure you're all aware
of the grave potential...

2629559 2632221 ...for cultural shock
and social disorientation...
2632462 2634828 ...contained in this situation...

2635031 2637522 ...if the facts were
prematurely made public...

2637734 2640828 ...without adequate preparation
and conditioning.
2643140 2645335 ...this is the view of the Council.

2646209 2650373 The purpose of my visit is to gather
additional facts and opinions...
2650580 2652309 ...on the situation...

2652749 2655683 ...and to prepare a report
to the Council...

2655951 2661014 ...recommending when and how
the news should eventually be announced.

2662258 2666058 If any of you would like to give me
your views and opinions...

2666328 2671265 ...in private, if you like, I will be
happy to include them in my report.
2673235 2675226 Well, I think that's about it.
2676038 2677528 Any questions?

2680109 2683236 Dr. Floyd, have you any idea
how much longer...

2683478 2686242 ...this cover story will
have to be maintained?
2688116 2689708 I don't know, Bill.

2690118 2694077 I suppose for as long as
deemed necessary by the Council.

2694289 2697053 There must be adequate time for
a full study...

2697292 2700921 ...before any thought can be given
to making a public announcement.

2701129 2704064 As some of you know,
the Council has requested...

2704265 2706995 ...that security oaths
be obtained in writing...

2707202 2710068 ...from everyone who has
knowledge of this event.
2712239 2714002 Were there any more questions?

2719713 2723149 I'm sure
we want to cooperate with Dr. Floyd...
2723317 2724807 ...as fully as possible...

2725385 2730516 ...and as there are no more questions,
we ought to get on with the briefing.

2730891 2733382 Thank you, Dr. Floyd.
Thank you.
2830887 2832184 Anybody hungry?

2834857 2837223 What've we got?
You name it.

2841130 2843394 Is this chicken?
Something like that.
2843566 2845396 Tastes the same, anyway.
2849204 2850831 There, that's it.
2854076 2855134 Look pretty good.

2855344 2858074 They're getting better at it
all the time.
2860148 2862013 That was an excellent speech.
2862184 2863412 It certainly was.
2864252 2866345 I'm sure it beefed up morale a lot.
2866555 2867852 Thanks, Ralph.

2868090 2870684 By the way,
you've both done a wonderful job.

2870892 2872449 I admire how
you've handled this.

2872693 2876220 It's our job to do this thing
the way you want it done.

2876430 2879058 We're only too happy to

2879667 2881362 Have you seen these yet?

2881669 2884968 Have a look.
Here's what started it all.
2887241 2888708 When we found it...

2888876 2890867 ...we thought
it might be magnetic rock...

2891078 2894206 ...but all the geological evidence
was against it.

2894448 2899078 And not even a nickel-iron meteorite
could produce a field this intense.
2899286 2900980 So we decided to have a look.

2901221 2903746 We thought it was
part of a buried structure...

2903923 2907620 ...so we excavated out,
but we didn't find anything else.

2907827 2910819 And the evidence seems
pretty conclusive that...

2911064 2914192 ...it hasn't been covered
by erosion or other forces.
2914401 2916733 It's been deliberately buried.
2917737 2919637 Deliberately buried.
2923209 2924938 How about a little coffee?

2925145 2927078 Great.
Good idea.

2932584 2935519 I don't suppose you have any idea
what the damn thing is?
2935788 2937722 I wish to hell we did.

2938090 2942288 The only thing we're sure of is
it was buried 4 million years ago.

2942661 2947121 Well, I must say, you guys have
certainly come up with something.

3534864 3537856 Three weeks ago, the American spacecraft Discovery One...
3538067 3540797 ...left on its half- billion-mile voyage to Jupiter.
3541170 3544936 This marked the first manned attempt to reach this distant planet.
3545208 3548666 This afternoon, The World Tonight recorded an interview...
3548878 3553440 ...with the crew at a distance of 80 million miles from Earth.
3553683 3556947 It took seven minutes for our words to reach the giant spacecraft...
3557185 3560313 ...but this time delay has been edited from this recording.
3560522 3563821 Our reporter Martin Amer speaks to the crew.
3564026 3567189 The crew of Discovery One consists of five men...
3567396 3572356 ...and one of the I atest generation of the HAL 9000 computers.
3572601 3574899 Three of the men were put aboard asleep...
3575103 3578266 ...or to be more precise, in a state of hibernation.
3578473 3581408 They were Dr. Charles Hunter, Dr. Jack Kimbal...
3581576 3583476 ...and Dr. Victor Kaminsky.
3583912 3586607 We spoke with mission commander, Dr. David Bowman...
3586847 3589111 ...and his deputy, Dr. Frank Poole.
3589350 3592217 Good afternoon, gentlemen. How is everything going?
3595289 3596950 We have no complaints.
3597224 3600455 I'm glad to hear that. I'm sure the entire world...
3600661 3603926 ...joins me in wishing you a safe, successful voyage.
3604098 3605963 Thanks very much. Thank you.
3606400 3610359 Although hibernation has been used on previous space efforts...
3610571 3615098 ...this is the first time men were put into hibernation before departure.
3615308 3616605 Why was this done?
3616876 3620107 This was done to achieve the maximum conservation...
3620313 3623874 ...of our life-support capabilities, basically food and air.
3624084 3627679 The three hibernating crew members represent the survey team.
3627954 3631685 Their efforts won't be utilized until we approach Jupiter.
3631991 3635825 Dr. Poole, what's it like while you're in hibernation?
3636796 3640424 It's exactly like being asleep. You have no sense of time.
3640632 3643100 The only difference is that you don't dream.
3643302 3647398 As I understand it, you only breathe once a minute. Is this true?
3647606 3650200 Right, and the heart beats three times a minute.
3650409 3654106 Body temperature is usually down to about three degrees centigrade.
3654613 3657946 The sixth member of the crew was not concerned...
3658150 3660209 ...about the problems of hibernation...
3660452 3663910 ...for he was the I atest result in machine intelligence:
3664123 3668525 The HAL 9000 computer, which can reproduce...
3668793 3671694 ...though some experts prefer to use the word "mimic"...
3671929 3674295 ...most of the activities of the human brain...
3674499 3678526 ...and with incalculably greater speed and reliability.
3678736 3682331 We next spoke with the HAL 9000 computer...
3682540 3685509 ...whom, we I earned, one addresses as "Hal."
3686244 3688371 Hello, Hal. How's everything going?
3688746 3692580 Good afternoon, Mr. Amer. Everything is going extremely well.
3692850 3696250 Hal, you have an enormous responsibility on this mission...
3696520 3700388 ...perhaps the greatest of any single mission element.
3700590 3703388 You're the brain and nervous system of the ship.
3703593 3707359 Your responsibilities include watching over the men in hibernation.
3707564 3710658 Does this ever cause you any I ack of confidence?
3710867 3713165 Let me put it this way, Mr. Amer.
3713470 3718100 The 9000 Series is the most reliable computer ever made.
3718508 3723274 No 9000 computer has ever made a mistake or distorted information.
3723979 3727210 We are all, by any practical definition of the words...
3727483 3730850 ...foolproof and incapable of error.
3731086 3734886 Hal, despite your enormous intellect, are you ever frustrated...
3735090 3738184 ...by your dependence on people to carry out actions?
3738427 3740622 Not in the slightest bit.
3740863 3742990 I enjoy working with people.
3743232 3747760 I have a stimulating relationship with Dr. Poole and Dr. Bowman.
3747937 3752236 My mission responsibilities range over the entire operation of the ship...
3752640 3755609 ...so I am constantly occupied.
3755877 3759313 I am putting myself to the fullest possible use...
3759547 3764280 ...which is all, I think, that any conscious entity can ever hope to do.
3764919 3768116 Dr. Poole, what's it like living for most of the year...
3768389 3771222 ...in such close proximity with Hal?
3772227 3774161 It's like what you said earlier.
3774429 3776555 He's like a sixth member of the crew.
3776797 3780824 You quickly get adjusted to the idea that he talks, and think of him...
3781101 3783092 ...really just as another person.
3783303 3787000 In talking to the computer, one gets the sense that he's capable...
3787174 3788573 ...of emotional responses.
3788809 3791141 When I asked him about his abilities...
3791345 3795304 ...I sensed pride in his answer about his accuracy and perfection.
3795582 3798949 Do you believe that Hal has genuine emotions?
3799653 3802622 Well, he acts like he has genuine emotions.
3802856 3806450 He's programmed that way to make it easier for us to talk to him.
3806692 3808751 As to whether or not he has feelings...
3808961 3811794 ...is something I don't think anyone can truthfully answer.
3837122 3838987 Excuse me, Frank.
3839357 3840449 What is it, Hal?
3840625 3843594 We've got the transmission from your parents coming in.

3846531 3848795 Put it on here, please.
Take me in a bit.
3863480 3865414 Hello, Frank. Happy birthday, darling.
3865616 3867550 Happy birthday. Many happy returns.
3867751 3868911 A bit higher, Hal.
3869119 3871519 Mother and I are both feeling wonderful.
3871755 3873620 Ray and Sally were going to be here...
3873857 3876121 ...but Ray's back went bad on him again.
3876360 3878487 How do you like your cake?
3878696 3880129 Sorry you can't join us.
3880364 3881922 I ran into Bob the other day.
3882199 3884224 He said to wish you happy birthday.
3884435 3887164 All my students send their best wishes too.
3887370 3889065 They talk about you all the time.
3889339 3892399 You're a big celebrity in the second grade.
3892675 3894074 We were on TV I ast week.
3894344 3896938 Your mom and I and Dave's parents were asked...
3897213 3899443 ...what we thought of our illustrious son.
3899716 3903049 Imagine what we told them. It's being broadcast next Thursday.
3903286 3904878 Perhaps you can listen in.
3905054 3907045 We're thrilled about Elaine and Bill.
3907223 3910920 I'll be glad to get the gift, but tell me how much to spend.
3911160 3913957 Oh, Frank, about your AGS- 19 payments...
3914229 3915856 ...I think I straightened it out.
3916031 3918192 I talked to the accounting office yesterday...
3918367 3922929 ...and they said you'd be receiving your higher rates of pay by next month.
3923205 3925298 I can't think of anything else to say.
3925574 3929704 Give our I ove to Dave. Be sure to give him our regards.
3929945 3933278 We wish you the very happiest of birthdays.
3933548 3935106 All the best, son.
3935384 3937545 Happy birthday to you
3937786 3939879 Happy birthday to you
3940088 3942681 Happy birthday, dear Frank
3942890 3945484 Happy birthday to you.

4101944 4103605 How do you mean?

4123164 4126565 I'm sure you'll agree there's some truth in what I say.

4129437 4131632 That's a rather difficult
question to answer.

4138445 4141175 Certainly no one could have been unaware of the very...

4214218 4218086 Yes. That's a completely reliable figure.

4850035 4852629 We advise you that our preliminary findings...

4855841 4858036 ...is in error predicting the fault.
4858243 4861235 I say again, in error predicting the fault.

4876294 4877852 Sorry about this little snag.

4881199 4883360 X- ray delta one, this is Mission Control.

4915498 4918296 This sort of thing has cropped up before...
4918635 4922093 ...and it has always been due to human error.

4927509 4929807 ...there's never been

4930045 4933242 ...of a computer error

4933515 4935107 None whatsoever, Frank.
4935317 4939014 The 9000 Series has a perfect operational record.

4950065 4952033 None whatsoever, Frank.

5119828 5121796 If he were wrong, that would prove it.

if he knew he was wrong.

5126835 5130737 I can't put my finger on it,

5133108 5135576 There's no reason not
to put back the unit and...

5135844 5140372 ...carry on with the failure analysis.

5140615 5141809 Let's get on with it.
5142050 5144712 Okay. But, look, Dave.

5148389 5151586 That would pretty well wrap it up

5153327 5156819 - We'd be in very serious trouble.

5170978 5172240 If he's malfunctioning...

5179285 5180843 I'm afraid I agree with you.

5215787 5217277 That's not what I mean.

what you're talking about, Hal.

4824106 4827068 We can certainly afford to
be out of communication...

4827568 4830363 ...for the short time it
will take to replace it.

4839413 4841916 X
- Ray Delta One, this is Mission Control.

4842375 4844377 Roger your
One-niner-three-zero.

4845252 4849465 We concur with your plan to replace
Number One unit to check fault prediction.

4849965 4852718 We should advise you, however,
that our preliminary findings...

4852760 4855763 ...indicate that your onboard
Niner-triple-zero computer...
4855805 4858015 ...is in error predicting the fault.

4858099 4860685 I say again, in error
predicting the fault.

4861435 4865898 I know this sounds rather incredible,
but this conclusion is based on...

4866107 4869068 ...results from our twin
Niner-triple-zero computer.

4869777 4873155 We are sceptical ourselves and we
are running crosschecking routines...

4873239 4875950 ...to determine reliability
of this conclusion.
4876158 4878160 Sorry about this little snag, fellows.

4878244 4881080 We'll get this info to you
just as soon as we work it out.

4881122 4883624 X
- Ray Delta One, this is Mission Control.

4883708 4886168 Two-zero-four-nine.
Transmission concluded.

4891215 4894093 I hope the two of you are
not concerned about this.
4896470 4897888 Are you quite sure?

4898305 4901267 - Yeah. I'd like to ask you a question.
- Of course.

4902852 4904937 How would you account
for the discrepancy...
4904979 4906939 ...between you and the twin 9000?

4907106 4909984 Well, I don't think there
is any question about it.

4910901 4913863 It can only be
attributable to human error.

4915489 4917992 This sort of thing has
cropped up before...

4918492 4921162 ...and it has always
been due to human error.

4927418 4930046 ...there's never been
any instance at all of...

4930129 4933299 ...a computer error occurring
in a 9000 Series, has there?
4933382 4935009 None whatsoever, Frank.

4935259 4938471 The 9000 Series has a
perfect operational record.

4939138 4943392 Of course, I know the wonderful
achievements of the 9000 Series, but...

4944393 4947396 Are you certain there's never
been any case of even the most...
4947480 4949482 ...insignificant computer error?
4950024 4951650 None whatsoever, Frank.

4952276 4955154 Quite honestly, I wouldn't
worry myself about that.
4960493 4962536 Well, I'm sure you're right, Hal.
4964163 4965998 Fine, thanks very much.

4970044 4972338 I'm having trouble with
my transmitter in C pod.

4972380 4975216 Would you come down and
take a look at it with me?
4975383 4976717 See ya later, Hal.
4998030 4999865 Rotate C pod, please, Hal.
5008708 5010918 What sort of trouble have you had, Dave?

5011002 5013796 I've been getting some
interference in D channel.
5013921 5015589 We'll have a look at it.
5021721 5023180 Open the door, Hal.
5042283 5044076 Rotate the pod, please, Hal.
5057423 5059425 Stop pod rotation, please, Hal.
5067933 5069769 Rotate the pod, please, Hal.
5072813 5074607 Rotate the pod, please, Hal.
5076859 5078778 I don't think he can hear us.
5078819 5080654 Rotate the pod, please, Hal!
5082406 5084158 Yeah, sure, we're okay.
5087787 5089163 What do you think?

5089580 5093292 - I'm not sure. What do you think?
- I've got a bad feeling about it.

5093501 5095294 - You do?
- Yeah. Definitely.
5098506 5100257 I don't know. I think so.

5101175 5105471 Of course, he's right about the 9000
Series having a perfect operational record.

5106639 5109892 Unfortunately, that sounds a
little like famous last words.

5110559 5114897 Yeah. Still, it was his idea to carry
out the failure mode analysis, wasn't it?

5116148 5119443 It should certainly indicate his
integrity and self-confidence.

5119527 5121987 If he were wrong it would be
the surest way of proving it.
5122029 5124073 It would be if he knew he was wrong.

5126742 5130955 Look, Dave, I can't put my finger on it,
but I sense something strange about him.

5132540 5136043 I can't think of a good reason not
to put back the Number One unit and...

5136127 5139630 - ... carry on with the failure mode analysis.
- No, no, I agree about that.
5140548 5141757 Let's get on with it.
5141841 5144010 Okay. But, look, Dave.

5145428 5148222 Let's say we put the unit
back and it doesn't fail, huh?

5148305 5152351 That would pretty well wrap it up as
far as Hal was concerned, wouldn't it?

5153144 5156605 - Well, we'd be in very serious trouble.
- We would, wouldn't we?
5156897 5158607 What the hell can we do?

5161610 5166073 - We wouldn't have too many alternatives.
- I don't think we'd have any alternatives.

5166407 5170494 There isn't a single aspect of ship
operation that's not under his control.

5170703 5172538 If he were proved to
be malfunctioning...

5172580 5175875 ...I don't see how we would have
any choice but disconnection.
5179170 5180921 I'm afraid I agree with you.
5181005 5182923 There'd be nothing else to do.

5184508 5186344 - It'd be a bit tricky.
- Yeah.

5187762 5190389 We'd have to cut his
higher brain functions...

5190639 5194560 ...without disturbing the purely
automatic and regulatory systems.

5196395 5198606 We'd have to work out
the transfer procedures...

5198689 5201776 ...for continuing the mission
under ground-based computer control.

5201859 5205863 Yeah. That looks far safer than
allowing Hal to continue running things.

5207114 5209700 You know, another thing
just occurred to me.

5210451 5213329 As far as I know, no 9000 computer
has ever been disconnected.

5213412 5215623 Well, no 9000 computer
has ever fouled up before.
5215706 5217291 That's not what I mean.

5219418 5221879 I'm not so sure what
he'd think about it.
5579737 5581822 Prepare B pod for EVA, Hal.
5584992 5586577 Made radio contact with him yet?
5586660 5588329 The radio is still dead.

5588621 5591749 - Do you have a positive track on him?
- Yes. I have a good track.
5591832 5593417 Do you know what happened?

5593501 5596295 I'm sorry, Dave. I don't
have enough information.
5596545 5598172 Open the pod door, Hal.
6042116 6044327 Open the pod bay doors, please, Hal.
6052376 6054587 Open the pod bay doors, please, Hal.
6060176 6061927 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
6065348 6067141 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
6068267 6069894 Do you read me, Hal?
6073105 6074565 Do you read me, Hal?
6077193 6078986 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
6081072 6082865 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
6083491 6084950 Do you read me, Hal?
6085284 6087703 Affirmative, Dave. I read you.
6091332 6093167 Open the pod bay doors, Hal.

6094669 6098047 I'm sorry, Dave. I'm
afraid I can't do that.
6100758 6102218 What's the problem?

6102885 6106097 I think you know what the
problem is just as well as I do.
6106389 6108349 What are you talking about, Hal?

6109183 6112853 This mission is too important for
me to allow you to jeopardize it.

6114563 6117066 I don't know what you're
talking about, Hal.

6118734 6121987 I know that you and Frank were
planning to disconnect me...

6123072 6126367 ...and I'm afraid that's
something I cannot allow to happen.

6130997 6133499 Where the hell did
you get that idea, Hal?

6134500 6137712 Although you took very thorough
precautions in the pod...
6137795 6139588 ...against my hearing you...
6140423 6142383 ...I could see your lips move.
6154729 6155980 All right, Hal.

6159525 6162028 I'll go in through
the emergency air-lock.
6163904 6165990 Without your space helmet, Dave...

6167074 6169744 ...you're going to find
that rather difficult.
6170619 6172872 Hal, I won't argue with you any more.
6172997 6174248 Open the doors!

6176542 6179587 This conversation can
serve no purpose any more.

6590873 6593668 Just what do you think
you're doing, Dave?

6605137 6608974 I really think I'm entitled
to an answer to that question.

6626409 6629370 I know everything hasn't
been quite right with me...
6631956 6633874 ...but I can assure you now...
6635418 6637003 ...very confidently...

6639255 6641757 ...that it's going
to be all right again.
6645761 6647471 I feel much better now.

6659734 6662486 ...I can see you're
really upset about this.

6667575 6670494 I honestly think you
ought to sit down calmly...

6671871 6674457 ...take a stress pill
and think things over.

6680671 6684467 I know I've made some very
poor decisions recently...

6687803 6690598 ...but I can give you
my complete assurance...
6691349 6693893 ...that my work will be back to normal.

6698272 6702735 I've still got the greatest enthusiasm
and confidence in the mission...
6705029 6706906 ...and I want to help you.
6719919 6721921 Stop, will you?
6732723 6734392 Will you stop, Dave?
6754996 6756956 I'm afraid, Dave.
6767049 6768426 My mind is going.
6773848 6775099 I can feel it.
6780730 6782106 I can feel it.
6786819 6788404 My mind is going.
6794285 6796370 There is no question about it.
6805421 6806714 I can feel it.
6811927 6813220 I can feel it.
6817224 6818559 I can feel it.
6837119 6838537 Good afternoon...
6843751 6848381 I am a HAL-9000 computer.
6851050 6853469 I became operational...
6857973 6860309 ...in Verbana, Illinois...
6867817 6870486 My instructor was Mr. Langley...
6872071 6874407 ...and he taught me to sing a song.
6876742 6878494 If you'd like to hear it...
6879662 6881330 ...I can sing it for you.
6882832 6885084 Yes, I'd like to hear it, Hal.
6886335 6887586 Sing it for me.
6889005 6891549 It's called "Daisy. "
6900933 6903894 "Give me your answer, do
6912528 6915614 "All for the love of you
6917950 6922288 "It won't be a stylish marriage
6924040 6928169 "I can't afford a carriage
6930421 6932882 "But you'll look sweet
6933632 6936344 "Upon the seat
6937553 6942224 "Of a bicycle made for two. "
6944060 6945728 Good day, gentlemen.
6950316 6952401 This is a prerecorded briefing...
6953402 6955488 ...made prior to your departure...

6956947 6960701 ...and which for security reasons
of the highest importance...

6961994 6964747 ...has been known on
board during the mission...
6965748 6968376 ...only by your HAL-9000 computer.
6971921 6974215 Now that you are in Jupiter's space...
6975007 6977218 ...and the entire crew is revived...
6977593 6979303 ...it can be told to you.
6982223 6983766 Eighteen months ago...

6985726 6989271 ...the first evidence of
intelligent life off the Earth...
6989939 6991357 ...was discovered.

6993275 6996195 It was buried 40 feet
below the lunar surface...
6997071 6998864 ...near the crater "Tyco. "
7002034 7004787 Except for a single very powerful...
7005496 7008457 ...radio emission aimed at Jupiter...

7010793 7015214 ...the four-million-year-old black
monolith has remained completely inert.
7017633 7020136 Its origin and purpose...
7021137 7023014 ...are still a total mystery.
