lines:
1543907 1546281 Here you are, sir.
Main level, please.
1547246 1549077 Right. See you on the way back.

1551876 1553410 - Good morning, sir.
- Good morning.

1553455 1555469 We haven't seen you up here
for a long time.
1555502 1556878 No. Very nice to see you again.

1556961 1559797 - Did you have a pleasant flight, sir?
- Yes, very nice, thanks.

1559843 1563056 I think Mr. Miller of Station Security
is supposed to be meeting me.
1563132 1564135 May I call him for you?
1564219 1565387 Would you, please? Here he is!

1565471 1567431 - Hello, Dr. Floyd.
- Hello, Miller! How are you?

1567473 1569725 - Sorry I'm late.
- That's all right. You look great.

1569808 1571643 Thank you.
It's nice to have you back.

1571685 1574063 - Did you have a good flight?
- Very nice indeed.

1574146 1575606 - Well, shall we go through?
- Okay.
1575647 1577149 Will you please use Number 17?

1577191 1578984 - Thank you, Miss Turner.
- Thank you.
1585449 1587701 Welcome to Voice Print Identification.
1587951 1589870 When you see the red light go on ...

1589953 1592414 would you please state
in the following order:

1592498 1596335 your destination, your nationality
and your full name.

1596794 1599630 Surname first,
Christian name and initial.
1601340 1605302 Moon. American. Floyd, Heywood R.

1608013 1611975 Thank you. You are cleared
through Voice Print Identification.
1620734 1622403 Have I got time for breakfast?
1622486 1623946 I think we can manage that.
1624029 1625239 How long have I got?

1625322 1627950 Your flight leaves
in an hour and ten minutes.

1628033 1630994 I've reserved a table for you
in the Earthlight Room.

1631662 1635165 It's been about seven or eight months
since you were here last, isn't it?
1635249 1636959 Let's see. Yeah, about eight months.

1637042 1640337 I suppose you saw the work on the
new section when you came in here?

1640379 1642715 - Yes, coming along great, huh?
- Yeah, it's fine.
1642798 1643882 Oh, wait a minute!

1643966 1647386 I've got a few calls to make.
I'll meet you in the restaurant.

1665571 1668407 Will Mr. Travers please contact
the Met Office?

1669658 1672578 Will Mr. Travers
please contact the Met Office?

1679918 1681712 - How are you, squirt?
- All right.
1681754 1683255 What are you doin'?
1686091 1687342 Where's Mommy?
1687843 1689261 Gone to shopping.

1689553 1691889 - Well, who's taking care of ya?
- Rachel.
1692222 1693891 May I speak to Rachel, please?
1693932 1695726 She's gone to the bathroom.
1695851 1698270 Are you coming to my party tomorrow?
1698812 1701023 I'm sorry, sweetheart, but I can't.
1703108 1705527 Well, you know, Daddy's traveling.

1705819 1708197 Very sorry about it,
but I just can't!

1709615 1712451 I'm gonna send you
a very nice present, though.

1715245 1717581 - Anything special that you want?
- Yes.
1719083 1720209 A telephone.
1721168 1723170 We've got lots of telephones already.

1723253 1726006 Can't you think of anything else
you want for your birthday?
1726090 1727549 Something very special?

1731136 1733680 A bush baby?
Well, we'll have to see about that.

1733764 1735724 I want you to tell Mommy
something for me.

1735808 1737684 - Will you remember?
- Yes.

1738018 1740479 Well, tell Mommy
that I telephoned. Okay?

1742481 1745109 And that I'll try
to telephone again tomorrow.
1745567 1747361 Now, will you tell her that?

1749405 1752324 Okay, sweetheart.
Now, have a nice birthday tomorrow.

1753826 1756662 And have a nice birthday party
tomorrow, too, huh?

1758831 1761709 Okay, now, take care and be
a good girl, won't you?
1761792 1763127 All right. Bye-bye!
1763168 1765754 Bye-bye! Happy birthday.
1779435 1781645 Elena, how nice to see you again.

1781687 1783814 What a wonderful surprise
to meet you here!

1783856 1786942 - You're looking wonderful.
- Thank you. You're looking well, too.

1787026 1789194 This is my good friend,
Dr. Heywood Floyd.

1789278 1791739 - I'd like you to meet Dr. Kalinan.
- How do you do?

1791822 1793949 - Dr. Stretyneva.
- How do you do?
1794033 1795868 And this is Dr. Andrei Smyslov.

1795951 1798579 How do you do?
I've heard a lot about you.
1798662 1800122 Won't you sit down?

1800539 1802374 - Well, we —
- No, no, please.
1802916 1804376 Well, thank you.

1804668 1807671 - Would you like a drink, Doctor?
- No, thank you.

1807755 1811050 I haven't had breakfast yet.
Someone's meeting me in the restaurant.

1811133 1814011 I'll just sit with you a few minutes
and then I must be off.

1814053 1817097 - Are you quite sure?
- I'm quite sure, thank you.

1817723 1819850 - And how's Gregor?
- He's fine.

1820225 1823562 He's been doing some underwater
research in the Baltic so ...

1823729 1827858 I'm afraid we don't get a chance to
see very much of each other these days.

1827900 1830027 When you do see him,
give him my regards, huh?
1830069 1831570 Yes, of course.

1831945 1834531 Well, where are you all off to?
Up or down?
1834656 1836200 Oh, we're going home.

1836367 1840579 We have just spent three months
calibrating the new antennae at Tchalinko.

1841455 1844291 - And what about you?
- I'm just on my way up to Clavius.

1848379 1851673 Dr. Floyd, I hope you don't think
I'm being too inquisitive, but ...

1851757 1854259 perhaps you can clear up
the great big mystery ...
1854343 1856553 about what is going on up there.

1857930 1859890 I'm afraid I don't know
what you mean.

1859932 1862059 Oh, it's just that
for the past two weeks ...

1862101 1865437 some extremely odd things
have been happening at Clavius.

1865771 1867439 - Oh, really?
- Yes, yes.

1868107 1872444 For one thing, whenever you phone the
base all you get is a recording which ...

1872653 1876782 repeats that the phone lines
are temporarily out of order.

1878367 1882079 Probably having some trouble with
their equipment or something like that.

1882162 1884748 That's what we thought
was the explanation at first ...

1884790 1887376 but it has been going on now
for the past ten days.

1887459 1890462 You have not been able to contact
anyone for the past ten days?
1893006 1894633 And there's another thing, Heywood.

1894717 1897720 Two days ago, one of our rocket
buses was denied permission ...
1897803 1900097 for an emergency landing at Clavius.
1900180 1901473 That does sound odd.

1901557 1904935 Yes, yes. I'm afraid there's going
to be a bit of a row about that.

1904977 1908939 Denying the men permission to land is a
direct violation of the I.A.S. Convention.
1909023 1910816 Yes, of course. Of course.

1910858 1913736 - Did the crew get back all right?
- Yes, fortunately they did.
1913819 1915696 Well, I'm glad about that.

1919158 1923120 At the risk of pressing you on a point
you seem reticent to discuss ...

1923454 1926040 may I ask you
a straightforward question?
1926248 1927583 Well, certainly.

1930419 1934465 Quite frankly, we have had some very
reliable intelligence reports that ...

1934965 1938177 quite a serious epidemic
has broken out on Clavius.

1938677 1941430 Something, apparently,
of an unknown origin.

1942806 1945100 Is this, in fact,
what has happened?
1950522 1952483 I'm sorry, Dr. Smyslov, but ...

1954026 1956695 I'm really not at liberty
to discuss this.
1958364 1959573 I understand.

1960616 1964078 But this epidemic could quite
easily spread to our base.

1964286 1966538 We should be given
all the facts, Dr. Floyd.

1971418 1974004 As I said, I'm not
at liberty to discuss it.

1977174 1980260 Now, are you sure you won't
change your mind about that drink?

1980344 1982471 No, I'm positive.
Now, I really must be going.

1982554 1985974 I hope that you and your wife can come
to the I.A.C. Conference in June.

1986058 1987685 We're gonna try.
Hope we can make it.

1987768 1991355 And if you do, you remember to bring
that darling little daughter with you!

1991397 1994858 Well, that will all depend on school
vacations and all that sort of thing.
1994900 1995859 But if we can, we will.

1995901 1999488 Don't forget you have a standing
invitation if you ever get to the States.

1999571 2002574 No, of course not. Gregor and I
will look forward to seeing you.
2002658 2004243 Well, goodbye, Elena.

2004743 2007663 It has been a pleasure meeting
you all, Dr. Smyslov.

2007746 2011709 Whatever the reasons for your visit to
Clavius, the very best of luck to you.
2489895 2491355 Excuse me, Dr. Halvorsen.

2491397 2493649 I'm through now.
Thank you very much, gentlemen.
2493732 2494858 You're welcome.

2509748 2514169 I know you will all want to join
with me in welcoming our ...
2514962 2517047 distinguished friend and colleague ...

2517089 2520926 from the National Council of
Astronautics, Dr. Heywood Floyd.

2521552 2526265 Dr. Floyd has come up specially
to Calvius to be with us today.

2527766 2531270 And before the briefing I know he'd
like to have a few words with you.
2545409 2547578 Thank you, Dr. Halvorsen.
2547619 2548954 Hi, everybody.
2549121 2551081 Nice to be back again.

2553792 2557254 First of all, I bring a personal
message from Dr. Howell who ...

2557421 2560674 has asked me to convey his deepest
appreciation to all of you ...

2560758 2563635 for the many sacrifices
you have had to make.

2563927 2567222 And, of course, his congratulations
on your discovery ...

2568307 2572770 which may well prove to be among the most
significant in the history of science.

2577149 2580986 I know there have been some
conflicting views held by some of you ...

2581320 2584615 regarding the need for
complete security in this matter.

2585157 2588410 More specifically, your
opposition to the cover story ...

2589370 2593332 created to give the impression that
there is an epidemic at the base.

2593957 2597211 I understand that beyond it
being a matter of principle ...

2598379 2602091 many of you are troubled
by the concern and anxiety ...

2602174 2606553 this story of an epidemic might cause
to your relatives and friends on Earth.

2607513 2610683 Well, I completely sympathize
with your negative views.

2612476 2615521 I find this cover story
personally embarrassing myself.

2616939 2620693 However, I accept the need
for absolute secrecy in this.
2622027 2623862 And I hope you will, too.

2626365 2629535 Now, I'm sure you are all aware
of the extremely grave potential ...

2629618 2632287 for cultural shock
and social disorientation ...
2632371 2634498 contained in this present situation ...

2634540 2637543 if the facts were prematurely
and suddenly made public ...

2637584 2640379 without adequate preparation
and conditioning.

2642339 2644717 Anyway, this is the view
of the Council.

2646176 2650180 The purpose of my visit here is to
gather additional facts and opinions ...
2650389 2651932 on the situation ...

2652725 2655310 and to prepare a report
to the Council ...
2655894 2657855 recommending when and how ...

2658939 2661442 the news should eventually
be announced.

2662234 2665946 Now, if any of you would like to
give me your views and opinions ...

2666238 2670576 in private if you like, I will be only
too happy to include them in my report.
2673203 2675122 Well, I think that's about it.
2675956 2677332 Any questions?

2680085 2684298 Dr. Floyd, have you any idea
how much longer this cover story ...
2684381 2686341 will have to be maintained?
2688093 2689553 I don't know, Bill.

2690095 2693891 I suppose it will be maintained as long
as is deemed necessary by the Council.

2693932 2697519 There must be adequate time for a full
study to be made on the situation ...

2697603 2700981 before any thought can be given
to making a public announcement.

2701065 2704276 Oh, yes, as some of you already know,
the Council has requested ...

2704360 2707279 that formal security oaths are
to be obtained in writing ...

2707321 2710115 from everyone who has
any knowledge of this event.
2712159 2714286 Are there any more questions?

2719708 2724380 I'm sure we all want to cooperate
with Dr. Floyd as fully as possible ...

2725714 2728425 and as there seems
to be no more questions ...

2728717 2730844 I think we ought to get on
with the briefing.

2730928 2733389 - Thank you, Dr. Floyd.
- Thank you.
2830736 2832237 Anybody hungry?

2834740 2836700 - What we've got?
- You name it.

2841163 2843415 - What's this? Chicken?
- Something like that.
2843499 2845042 Tastes the same, anyway.

2854093 2858180 - Looks pretty good.
- They're getting better at it all the time.

2859932 2862184 That was an excellent speech
you gave us, Heywood.
2862267 2863435 It certainly was.

2864061 2866146 I'm sure it beefed up
morale a hell of a lot.
2866230 2867398 Thanks, Ralph.

2867439 2870776 I want to say to both of you that
I think you've done a wonderful job.

2870859 2872778 I appreciate the way
you've handled this thing.

2872820 2876699 Well, the way we look at it, it's our job
to do this thing the way you want it done.

2876782 2879076 And we're only too happy
to be able to oblige.
2879618 2881203 Have you seen these yet?
2881286 2882621 Take a look at them.
2882705 2884998 Here's what started the whole thing.

2887167 2890963 When we first found it, we thought it
might be an outcrop of magnetic rock ...

2891004 2894258 but all the geological
evidence was against it.

2894341 2899013 And not even a big nickel iron meteorite
could produce a field as intense as this.
2899304 2900723 So, we decided to have a look.

2900806 2903809 We thought it might be the upper
part of some buried structure ...
2903892 2905477 so we excavated out on all sides.

2905561 2907771 But, unfortunately,
we didn't find anything else.

2907855 2910899 And what's more, the evidence
seems pretty conclusive that ...

2910983 2914236 it has not been covered up by
natural erosion or other forces.

2914319 2917156 It seems to have been
deliberately buried.
2917656 2919116 Deliberately buried.
2923287 2924705 How about a little coffee?

2924788 2927041 - Great.
- Good idea.

2932421 2935466 I don't suppose you have any idea
what the damn thing is, huh?
2935507 2937384 I wish to hell we did.

2938010 2942014 No, the only thing we're sure of is
it was buried four million years ago.

2942556 2946643 Well, I must say, you guys have
certainly come up with something.
3533480 3534732 Good evening.

3534940 3538068 Three weeks ago, the American
spacecraft, Discovery One ...

3538110 3541030 left on its half-billion
mile voyage to Jupiter.

3541113 3544742 This marked the first manned attempt
to reach this distant planet.

3545200 3548537 Earlier this afternoon,
"The World Tonight" recorded an interview ...

3548620 3552833 with the crew of Discovery at a distance
of 80 million miles from Earth.

3553417 3557046 It took 7 minutes for our words
to reach the giant spacecraft ...

3557129 3560424 but this time delay has been
edited from this recording.

3560466 3563177 Our reporter, Martin Amer,
speaks to the crew.

3564094 3566972 The crew of Discovery One
consists of five men ...

3567348 3571810 and one of the latest generation
of the HAL-9000 computers.

3572603 3574980 Three of the five men
were put aboard asleep ...

3575022 3577983 or to be more precise,
in a state of hibernation.

3578442 3583113 They were Dr. Charles Hunter,
Dr. Jack Kimball and Dr. Victor Kaminsky.

3583947 3586784 We spoke with Mission Commander,
Dr. David Bowman ...
3586825 3589161 and his deputy, Dr. Frank Poole.

3589328 3592331 Well, good afternoon, gentlemen.
How is everything going?

3592373 3596210 Marvellous. We have no —
we have no complaints.

3597169 3600631 Well, I'm very glad to hear that
and I'm sure that the entire world ...

3600672 3604134 would join me in wishing you
a safe and successful voyage.

3604259 3606261 - Thanks very much.
- Thank you.

3606428 3610224 Although hibernation has been
used on previous space efforts ...

3610516 3614978 this is the first time that men have been
put into hibernation before departure.
3615020 3616397 Why was this done?

3616855 3620275 Well, this was done in order to achieve
the maximum conservation ...

3620359 3623737 of our life-support capabilities,
basically food and air.

3624029 3627658 Now, the three hibernating crew
members represent the survey team.

3627991 3631704 And their efforts won't be utilized
until we are approaching Jupiter.

3631954 3635249 Dr. Poole, what's it like
while you are in hibernation?

3636834 3640504 It's exactly like being asleep;
you have absolutely no sense of time.

3640546 3643007 The only difference is
you don't dream.

3643257 3645968 As I understand it,
you only breathe once a minute.
3646051 3647219 Is this true?

3648345 3652099 And your heart beats three times a minute,
body temperature is usually down ...
3652182 3654518 to about three degrees centigrade.

3654560 3658063 The sixth member of the Discovery crew
was not concerned ...
3658147 3660399 about the problems of hibernation.

3660482 3663527 For he was the latest result
in machine intelligence.

3664111 3668490 The HAL-9000 computer
which can reproduce ...

3668907 3671910 though some experts still prefer
to use the word "mimic" ...

3671994 3676915 most of the activities of the human brain
and with incalculably greater speed ...
3676999 3678417 and reliability.

3678751 3682379 We next spoke
with the HAL-9000 computer ...

3682588 3685382 whom, we learned,
one addresses as Hal.

3686258 3688635 Good afternoon, Hal.
How's everything going?

3688719 3692389 Good afternoon, Mr. Amer.
Everything's going extremely well.

3692848 3695642 Hal, you have an enormous
responsibility on this mission.

3695726 3698228 In many ways, perhaps
the greatest responsibility ...
3698312 3700397 of any single mission element.

3700564 3703525 You are the brain and central
nervous system of the ship.

3703609 3707488 Your responsibilities include
watching over the men in hibernation.

3707571 3710449 Does this ever cause you
any lack of confidence?
3710866 3712993 Let me put it this way, Mr. Amer.

3713452 3717414 The 9000 Series is the most
reliable computer ever made.

3718499 3722878 No 9000 computer has ever made
a mistake or distorted information.

3723962 3727091 We are all by any practical
definition of the words ...
3727466 3730260 fool proof and incapable of error.

3731053 3735057 Hal, despite your enormous intellect,
are you ever frustrated ...

3735140 3738102 by your dependence on people
to carry out actions?
3738477 3740187 Not in the slightest bit.
3740938 3742731 I enjoy working with people.

3743273 3747277 I have a stimulating relationship
with Dr. Poole and Dr. Bowman.

3747986 3752408 My mission responsibilities range over
the entire operation of the ship ...
3752741 3754743 so l am constantly occupied.

3755828 3758914 I am putting myself
to the fullest possible use ...

3759498 3764128 which is all, I think, that any
conscious entity can ever hope to do.

3764878 3768257 Dr. Poole, what's it like living
for the better part of a year ...
3768340 3770467 in such close proximity with Hal?

3771927 3774346 It's pretty close to what
you said about him earlier.

3774388 3776557 He's just like the
sixth member of the crew.

3776640 3780811 You very quickly get adjusted to the idea
that he talks. You think of him ...
3781020 3783147 really as just another person.

3783188 3786984 In talking to the computer, one gets
the sense that he is capable ...
3787026 3788527 of emotional response.

3788569 3791071 For example, when I asked him
about his abilities ...

3791155 3795242 I sensed a certain pride in his answer
about his accuracy and perfection.

3795534 3798287 Do you believe that Hal
has genuine emotions?

3799705 3802624 Oh, yes. Well, he acts
like he has genuine emotions.

3802833 3806545 Of course, he's programmed that way to
make it easier for us to talk to him.

3806628 3808881 But, as to whether or not
he has real feelings ...

3808964 3812217 is something I don't think
anyone can truthfully answer.
3837034 3838410 Excuse me, Frank.
3839328 3840454 What is it, Hal?

3840537 3843582 We've got the transmission
from your parents coming in.

3846460 3848921 Put it on here, please.
Take me in a bit.

3863352 3865062 - Hello, Frank.
- Happy birthday, darling.

3865145 3867398 Happy birthday.
Many happy returns of the day.
3867481 3868982 A bit higher, please.

3869066 3871276 Now, Mother and I are both
feeling wonderful, too.

3871360 3873362 Ray and Sally were going
to be here, too ...

3873445 3876198 but at the last minute
Ray's back went bad on him again.
3876281 3877741 How do you like your cake, dear?

3877783 3880285 Looks great, doesn't it?
Sorry you can't be with us.
3880327 3881829 Oh, I ran into Bob the other day.

3881912 3884081 He said to be sure
and wish you a happy birthday.

3884164 3887126 All my students made me promise
to send their best wishes, too.

3887167 3889753 You know they talk about you
all the time in the classroom.

3889837 3892297 You're a big celebrity
in the second grade.

3892381 3894133 You know we were on
television last week?

3894216 3897386 Oh, yes! Your mother and I
and Dave's parents were interviewed ...

3897469 3899596 about what we thought of
our illustrious son.

3899638 3903267 You can imagine what we told them.
I think it's being broadcast next Thursday.
3903350 3904935 Perhaps you'll be able to listen in.

3905102 3907271 Oh, we were thrilled
about Elaine and Bill, dear.

3907312 3911191 I'll be glad to get the present for you,
but please tell me how much to spend.

3911275 3913902 Oh, yes, Frank,
about your AGS-19 payments —

3913986 3915654 I think I straightened
it out for you.

3915738 3918365 I talked to the Accounting Office
in Houston yesterday ...

3918449 3922453 and they said you should be receiving
your higher rates of pay by next month.

3923162 3925456 Well, I can't think
of anything else to say.

3925497 3928959 - Oh, our love to Dave.
- Be sure to give him our best regards.

3929918 3932629 We wish you the very
happiest of birthdays.
3933505 3934882 All the best, son.
3947227 3948854 See you next Wednesday.
3952358 3953984 Happy birthday, Frank.

3955069 3957446 Thank you, Hal.
A bit flatter, please.
3976590 3978550 Anyway, queen takes pawn —
3980386 3982179 Bishop takes knight's pawn.

3992064 3994525 I'm sorry, Frank.
I think you missed it.

3995609 3998570 Queen to bishop, three.
Bishop takes queen.
3999363 4001365 Knight takes bishop. Mate.

4006120 4008622 Looks like you're right.
Very good.
4009498 4011500 Thank you for a very enjoyable game.

4050664 4052791 - Good evening, Dave.
- How are you doing, Hal?

4052875 4056253 - Everything's running smoothly. And you?
- Oh, not too bad.

4056295 4059298 - Have you been doing some more work?
- A few sketches.

4059423 4061133 - May I see them?
- Sure.
4065846 4068015 That's a very nice rendering, Dave.
4069183 4071435 I think you've improved a great deal.

4072853 4075105 - Can you hold it a bit closer?
- Sure.
4077983 4080069 That's Dr. Hunter, isn't it?

4085574 4088160 Do you mind
if I ask you a personal question?
4089161 4090621 No, no. Not at all.

4090954 4093874 Well, forgive me for
being so inquisitive ...

4095334 4097753 but during the past
few weeks I've wondered ...

4097836 4101799 whether you might have been having
some second thoughts about the mission?
4101840 4103217 How do you mean?
4105135 4107137 It's rather difficult to define.

4108764 4111809 Perhaps I'm just projecting
my own concern about it.

4113519 4117147 I know I've never completely
freed myself of the suspicion ...

4118023 4121485 that there are some extremely
odd things about this mission.

4123153 4126365 I'm sure you will agree there
is some truth in what I say.

4129201 4131954 I don't know. That's a rather
difficult question to answer.

4132037 4134665 You don't mind talking
about it, do you, Dave?
4135457 4136917 Oh, no, not at all.

4138252 4140504 Certainly no one could
have been unaware of ...

4140546 4143841 the very strange stories
floating around before we left.

4145384 4148262 Rumours of something
being dug up on the Moon.

4150097 4152641 I never gave these
stories much credence ...

4153642 4157771 but particularly in view of some of
the other things that have happened ...

4157938 4160649 I find them difficult
to put out of my mind.
4161400 4162693 For instance:

4163068 4166697 The way all our preparations were
kept under such tight security ...
4167948 4169533 and the melodramatic touch ...

4169575 4172953 of putting Drs. Hunter, Kimball
and Kaminsky aboard ...

4173746 4178000 already in hibernation after four months
of separate training on their own.

4179585 4182087 You working up your
crew psychology report?
4183714 4185090 Of course, I am.

4185507 4188552 Sorry about this.
I know it's a bit silly.
4190012 4191263 Just a moment.
4191889 4193098 Just a moment.

4194767 4198228 I have just picked up a fault
in the AE-35 unit.

4199772 4203442 It's going to go
100% failure within 72 hours.

4206278 4208906 - You are still within operational limits?
- Yes.

4209323 4211700 And it will stay that way
until it fails.

4211784 4214244 Would you say we had a
reliable 72 hours until failure?
4214328 4217414 Yes. That's a completely reliable figure.

4219833 4223087 We'll have to bring it in, but I'd
like to go over this with Frank ...

4223170 4227007 and get on to Mission Control.
Let me have a hard copy of it, please.
4309715 4312176 X-Ray Delta One, this is Mission Control.
4312676 4314928 Roger to your two-zero-one-three.

4315763 4318307 Sorry you fellows are having
a bit of trouble.

4318390 4322978 We are reviewing telematic information
in our Mission Simulator and will advise.

4323812 4329068 Roger your plan to go EVA and replace
Alpha-Echo-35 unit prior to failure.
4358013 4359807 Prepare "B" pod for EVA, Hal.
4381620 4383330 Open the pod doors, Hal.

4795075 4798328 Well, Hal, I'm damned if I
can find anything wrong with it.
4801832 4803167 it's puzzling.

4804543 4807880 I don't think I've ever seen
anything quite like this before.
4812009 4813469 I would recommend ...

4814219 4817639 that we put the unit back
in operation and let it fail.

4819099 4822353 It should then be a simple
matter to track down the cause.

4824104 4827066 We can certainly afford
to be out of communication ...

4827566 4830361 for the short time it
will take to replace it.

4839411 4841914 X-Ray Delta One,
this is Mission Control.
4842373 4844375 Roger your one-niner-three-zero.

4845250 4849463 We concur with your plan to replace
Number One unit to check fault prediction.

4849963 4852716 We should advise you, however,
that our preliminary findings ...

4852758 4855761 indicate that your onboard
Niner-triple-zero computer ...
4855803 4858013 is in error predicting the fault.

4858097 4860683 I say again,
in error predicting the fault.

4861433 4865896 I know this sounds rather incredible,
but this conclusion is based on ...

4866105 4869066 results from our twin
Niner-triple-zero computer.

4869775 4873153 We are sceptical ourselves and we are
running crosschecking routines ...

4873237 4875948 to determine reliability
of this conclusion.
4876156 4878158 Sorry about this little snag, fellows.

4878242 4881078 We'll get this info to you
just as soon as we work it out.

4881120 4883622 X-Ray Delta One,
this is Mission Control.

4883706 4886166 Two-zero-four-nine.
Transmission concluded.

4891213 4894091 I hope the two of you
are not concerned about this.
4896468 4897886 Are you quite sure?

4898303 4901265 - Yeah. I'd like to ask you a question.
- Of course.

4902850 4904935 How would you account for
the discrepancy ...
4904977 4906937 between you and the twin 9000?

4907104 4909982 Well, I don't think there is
any question about it.

4910899 4913861 It can only be attributable
to human error.

4915487 4917990 This sort of thing
has cropped up before ...

4918490 4921160 and it has always been due
to human error.

4927416 4930044 there's never been
any instance at all of ...

4930127 4933297 a computer error occurring
in a 9000 Series, has there?
4933380 4935007 None whatsoever, Frank.

4935257 4938469 The 9000 Series has a
perfect operational record.

4939136 4943390 Of course, I know the wonderful
achievements of the 9000 Series, but ...

4944391 4947394 Are you certain there's never been
any case of even the most ...
4947478 4949480 insignificant computer error?
4950022 4951648 None whatsoever, Frank.

4952274 4955152 Quite honestly,
I wouldn't worry myself about that.
4960491 4962534 Well, I'm sure you're right, Hal.
4964161 4965996 Fine, thanks very much.

4970042 4972336 I'm having trouble
with my transmitter in "C" pod.

4972378 4975214 Would you come down
and take a look at it with me?
4975381 4976715 See ya later, Hal.
4998028 4999863 Rotate "C" pod, please, Hal.

5008706 5010916 What sort of trouble
have you had, Dave?

5011000 5013794 I've been getting some
interference in "D" channel.
5013919 5015587 We'll have a look at it.
5021719 5023178 Open the door, Hal.
5042281 5044074 Rotate the pod, please, Hal.
5057421 5059423 Stop pod rotation, please, Hal.
5067931 5069767 Rotate the pod, please, Hal.
5072811 5074605 Rotate the pod, please, Hal.
5076857 5078776 I don't think he can hear us.
5078817 5080652 Rotate the pod, please, Hal!
5082404 5084156 Yeah, sure, we're okay.
5087785 5089161 What do you think?

5089578 5093290 - I'm not sure. What do you think?
- I've got a bad feeling about it.

5093499 5095292 - You do?
- Yeah. Definitely.
5098504 5100255 I don't know. I think so.

5101173 5105469 Of course, he's right about the 9000 Series
having a perfect operational record.

5106637 5109890 Unfortunately, that sounds
a little like famous last words.

5110557 5114895 Yeah. Still, it was his idea to carry out
the failure mode analysis, wasn't it?

5116146 5119441 It should certainly indicate his
integrity and self-confidence.

5119525 5121985 If he were wrong it would be
the surest way of proving it.

5122027 5124071 It would be
if he knew he was wrong.

5126740 5130953 Look, Dave, I can't put my finger on it,
but I sense something strange about him.

5132538 5136041 I can't think of a good reason not
to put back the Number One unit and ...

5136125 5139628 carry on with the failure mode analysis.
- No, no, I agree about that.
5140546 5141755 Let's get on with it.
5141839 5144008 Okay. But, look, Dave.

5145426 5148220 Let's say we put the unit back
and it doesn't fail, huh?

5148303 5152349 That would pretty well wrap it up as
far as Hal was concerned, wouldn't it?

5153142 5156603 - Well, we'd be in very serious trouble.
- We would, wouldn't we?
5156895 5158605 What the hell can we do?

5161608 5166071 - We wouldn't have too many alternatives.
- I don't think we'd have any alternatives.

5166405 5170492 There isn't a single aspect of ship
operation that's not under his control.

5170701 5172536 If he were proved
to be malfunctioning ...

5172578 5175873 I don't see how we would have
any choice but disconnection.
5179168 5180919 I'm afraid I agree with you.
5181003 5182921 There'd be nothing else to do.

5184506 5186342 - It'd be a bit tricky.
- Yeah.

5187760 5190387 We'd have to cut
his higher brain functions ...

5190637 5194558 without disturbing the purely
automatic and regulatory systems.

5196393 5198604 We'd have to work out
the transfer procedures ...

5198687 5201774 for continuing the mission under
ground-based computer control.

5201857 5205861 Yeah. That looks far safer than
allowing Hal to continue running things.

5207112 5209698 You know,
another thing just occurred to me.

5210449 5213327 As far as I know, no 9000 computer
has ever been disconnected.

5213410 5215621 Well, no 9000 computer
has ever fouled up before.
5215704 5217289 That's not what I mean.

5219416 5221877 I'm not so sure
what he'd think about it.
5579735 5581820 Prepare "B" pod for EVA, Hal.
5584990 5586575 Made radio contact with him yet?
5586658 5588327 The radio is still dead.

5588619 5591747 - Do you have a positive track on him?
- Yes. I have a good track.
5591830 5593415 Do you know what happened?

5593499 5596293 I'm sorry, Dave.
I don't have enough information.
5596543 5598170 Open the pod door, Hal.
6042114 6044325 Open the pod bay doors, please, Hal.
6052374 6054585 Open the pod bay doors, please, Hal.
6060174 6061925 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
6065346 6067139 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
6068265 6069892 Do you read me, Hal?
6073103 6074563 Do you read me, Hal?
6077191 6078984 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
6081070 6082863 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
6083489 6084948 Do you read me, Hal?
6085282 6087701 Affirmative, Dave. I read you.
6091330 6093165 Open the pod bay doors, Hal.

6094667 6098045 I'm sorry, Dave.
I'm afraid I can't do that.
6100756 6102216 What's the problem?

6102883 6106095 I think you know what the problem
is just as well as I do.
6106387 6108347 What are you talking about, Hal?

6109181 6112851 This mission is too important for me
to allow you to jeopardize it.

6114561 6117064 I don't know
what you're talking about, Hal.

6118732 6121985 I know that you and Frank
were planning to disconnect me ...

6123070 6126365 and I'm afraid that's something
I cannot allow to happen.

6130995 6133497 Where the hell did
you get that idea, Hal?

6134498 6137710 Although you took very thorough
precautions in the pod ...
6137793 6139586 against my hearing you ...
6140421 6142381 I could see your lips move.
6154727 6155978 All right, Hal.

6159523 6162026 I'll go in through
the emergency air-lock.
6163902 6165988 Without your space helmet, Dave ...
6167072 6169742 you're going to find that rather difficult.
6170617 6172870 Hal, I won't argue with you any more.
6172995 6174246 Open the doors!

6176540 6179585 This conversation can serve
no purpose any more.

6590871 6593666 Just what do you think
you're doing, Dave?

6605135 6608972 I really think I'm entitled
to an answer to that question.

6626407 6629368 I know everything hasn't been
quite right with me ...
6631954 6633872 but I can assure you now ...
6635416 6637001 very confidently ...
6639253 6641755 that it's going to be all right again.
6645759 6647469 I feel much better now.
6659732 6662484 I can see you're really upset about this.

6667573 6670492 I honestly think you ought
to sit down calmly ...

6671869 6674455 take a stress pill
and think things over.

6680669 6684465 I know I've made some very
poor decisions recently ...

6687801 6690596 but I can give you
my complete assurance ...
6691347 6693891 that my work will be back to normal.

6698270 6702733 I've still got the greatest enthusiasm
and confidence in the mission ...
6705027 6706904 and I want to help you.
6719917 6721919 Stop, will you?
6732721 6734390 Will you stop, Dave?
6754994 6756954 I'm afraid, Dave.
6767047 6768424 My mind is going.
6773846 6775097 I can feel it.
6780728 6782104 I can feel it.
6786817 6788402 My mind is going.
6794283 6796368 There is no question about it.
6805419 6806712 I can feel it.
6811925 6813218 I can feel it.
6817222 6818557 I can feel it.
6837117 6838535 Good afternoon ...
6843749 6848379 I am a HAL-9000 computer.
6851048 6853467 I became operational ...
6854510 6857471 at the HAL plant ...
6857971 6860307 in Verbana, Illinois ...
6861308 6865688 on the 12th of January, 1992.
6867815 6870484 My instructor was Mr. Langley ...
6872069 6874405 and he taught me to sing a song.
6876740 6878492 If you'd like to hear it ...
6879660 6881328 I can sing it for you.
6882830 6885082 Yes, I'd like to hear it, Hal.
6886333 6887584 Sing it for me.
6889003 6891547 It's called "Daisy."
6900931 6903892 ♪ Give me your answer, do ♪
6912526 6915612 ♪ All for the love of you ♪
6917948 6922286 ♪ It won't be a stylish marriage ♪
6924038 6928167 ♪ I can't afford a carriage ♪
6930419 6932880 ♪ But you'll look sweet ♪
6933630 6936342 ♪ Upon the seat ♪
6937551 6942222 ♪ Of a bicycle made for two. ♪
6944058 6945726 Good day, gentlemen.
6950314 6952399 This is a pre-recorded briefing ...
6953400 6955486 made prior to your departure ...

6956945 6960699 and which for security reasons
of the highest importance ...

6961992 6964745 has been known on board
during the mission ...
6965746 6968374 only by your HAL-9000 computer.
6971919 6974213 Now that you are in Jupiter's space ...
6975005 6977216 and the entire crew is revived ...
6977591 6979301 it can be told to you.
6982221 6983764 Eighteen months ago ...

6985724 6989269 the first evidence of
intelligent life off the Earth ...
6989937 6991355 was discovered.

6993273 6996193 It was buried 40 feet
below the lunar surface ...
6997069 6998862 near the crater "Tyco."
7002032 7004785 Except for a single very powerful ...
7005494 7008455 radio emission aimed at Jupiter ...

7010791 7015212 the 4-million-year-old black monolith
has remained completely inert.
7017631 7020134 Its origin and purpose ...
7021135 7023012 are still a total mystery.

lines: 1537619 1539746 Here you are, sir. Main level, please.
1541156 1542714 Right. See you on the way back.

1545994 1547325 - Good morning, sir.
- Good morning.

1547462 1549327 We haven't seen you up here
for a long time.
1549397 1550796 No. Very nice to see you again.

1550865 1553356 - Did you have a pleasant flight, sir?
- Yes, very nice, thanks.

1553435 1556302 I think Mr. Miller of Station Security
is supposed to be meeting me.
1556371 1557736 May I call him for you?
1557806 1559205 Would you, please? Here he is!

1559274 1561071 - Hello, Dr. Floyd.
- Hello, Miller! How are you?

1561142 1563133 - Sorry I'm late.
- That's all right. You look great.
1563211 1565304 Thank you. It's nice to have you back.

1565380 1567814 - Did you have a good flight?
- Very nice indeed.

1567882 1569349 - Well, shall we go through?
- Okay.
1569417 1570884 Will you please use Number 17?

1570952 1572681 - Thank you, Miss Turner.
- Thank you.
1579261 1581525 Welcome to Voice Print Identification.
1581896 1583693 When you see the red light go on...
1583765 1586233 ...would you please state in the following order:
1586301 1590135 Your destination, your nationality and your full name.
1590605 1593438 Surname first, Christian name and initial.
1595110 1598978 Moon. American. Floyd, Heywood R.
1601816 1605752 Thank you. You are cleared through Voice Print Identification.
1614663 1615994 Have I got time for breakfast?
1616064 1617691 I think we can manage that.
1617766 1618994 How long have I got?

1619067 1621695 Your flight leaves
in an hour and ten minutes.

1621770 1624739 I've reserved a table for you
in the Earthlight Room.

1625440 1628773 It's been about seven or eight months
since you were here last, isn't it?
1628843 1631004 Let's see. Yeah, about eight months.

1631079 1633377 I suppose you saw the work on
the new section when you came in here?

1633448 1636281 - Yes, coming along great, huh?
- Yeah, it's fine.
1636618 1637607 Oh, wait a minute!

1637686 1640917 I've got a few calls to make.
I'll meet you in the restaurant.
1659307 1662140 Will Mr. Travers please contact the Met Office?
1663411 1666312 Will Mr. Travers please contact the Met Office?
1673588 1675453 - How are you, squirt? - All right.
1675523 1677081 What are you doin'?
1679761 1680989 Where's Mommy?
1681529 1682928 Gone to shopping.
1683164 1685496 - Well, who's taking care of ya? - Rachel.
1685867 1687459 May I speak to Rachel, please?
1687535 1689298 She's gone to the bathroom.
1689537 1691971 Are you coming to my party tomorrow?
1692507 1694702 I'm sorry, sweetheart, but I can't.
1696745 1699179 Well, you know, Daddy's traveling.
1699447 1701813 Very sorry about it, but I just can't!

1703284 1706082 I'm gonna send you
a very nice present, though.
1708923 1711357 - Anything special that you want? - Yes.
1714796 1717128 We've got lots of telephones already.

1717232 1719530 Can't you think of anything else
you want for your birthday?
1719601 1721228 Something very special?

1724839 1727535 A bush baby?
Well, we'll have to see about that.

1727609 1729474 I want you to tell Mommy
something for me.
1729544 1731444 - Will you remember? - Yes.
1731546 1734014 Well, tell Mommy that I telephoned. Okay?

1736117 1738779 And that I'll try
to telephone again tomorrow.
1739187 1740984 Now, will you tell her that?

1743057 1746026 Okay, sweetheart.
Now, have a nice birthday tomorrow.

1747429 1750262 And have a nice birthday party
tomorrow, too, huh?

1752467 1755334 Okay, now, take care and be a good girl,
won't you?
1755403 1756768 All right. Bye-bye!
1756838 1759398 Bye-bye! Happy birthday.
1772954 1774945 Elena, how nice to see you again.

1775023 1777355 What a wonderful surprise
to meet you here!

1777425 1780656 - You're looking wonderful.
- Thank you. You're looking well, too.
1780728 1782821 This is my good friend, Dr. Heywood Floyd.

1782897 1785365 - I'd like you to meet Dr. Kalinan.
- How do you do?

1785433 1787560 - Dr. Stretyneva.
- How do you do?
1787635 1789500 And this is Dr. Andrei Smyslov.
1789571 1792199 How do you do? I've heard a lot about you.
1792273 1793740 Won't you sit down?

1794142 1796007 - Well, we...
- No, no, please.
1796544 1798011 Well, thank you.

1798279 1801180 - Would you like a drink, Doctor?
- No, thank you.

1801249 1804844 I haven't had breakfast yet.
Someone's meeting me in the restaurant.

1804919 1807547 I'll just sit with you a few minutes
and then I must be off.

1807622 1810648 - Are you quite sure?
- I'm quite sure, thank you.

1811359 1813486 - And how's Gregor?
- He's fine.

1813828 1817195 He's been doing some underwater research
in the Baltic so...

1817365 1821461 ...l'm afraid we don't get a chance
to see very much of each other these days.

1821703 1823466 When you do see him,
give him my regards, huh?
1823538 1824903 Yes, of course.

1825573 1828133 Well, where are you all off to?
Up or down?
1828276 1829834 Oh, we're going home.

1829978 1834210 We have just spent three months
calibrating the new antennae at Tchalinko.

1835083 1837916 - And what about you?
- I'm just on my way up to Clavius.

1841990 1845448 Dr. Floyd, I hope you don't think
I'm being too inquisitive, but...

1845527 1847893 ...perhaps you can clear up
the great big mystery...
1847962 1850157 ...about what is going on up there.
1851566 1853659 I'm afraid I don't know what you mean.
1853735 1855669 Oh, it's just that for the past two weeks...

1855737 1858865 ...some extremely odd things
have been happening at Clavius.

1859407 1861068 - Oh, really?
- Yes, yes.

1861776 1866110 For one thing, whenever you phone
the base all you get is a recording which...

1866281 1870411 ...repeats that the phone lines
are temporarily out of order.

1871986 1875888 Probably having some trouble with
their equipment or something like that.

1875957 1878016 That's what we thought
was the explanation at first...

1878092 1881027 ...but it has been going on now
for the past ten days.

1881229 1884062 You have not been able to contact anyone
for the past ten days?
1887001 1888593 And there's another thing, Heywood.

1888670 1891161 Two days ago, one of our rocket buses
was denied permission...
1891239 1893707 ...for an emergency landing at Clavius.
1893975 1895101 That does sound odd.

1895176 1898543 Yes, yes. I'm afraid there's going to be
a bit of a row about that.

1898613 1902572 Denying the men permission to land is
a direct violation of the I.A.S. Convention.
1902650 1904675 Yes, of course. Of course.

1904752 1907186 - Did the crew get back all right?
- Yes, fortunately they did.
1907255 1908882 Well, I'm glad about that.

1912794 1916787 At the risk of pressing you
on a point you seem reticent to discuss...

1917065 1919659 ...may I ask you
a straightforward question?
1919867 1921198 Well, certainly.

1924038 1928065 Quite frankly, we have had some
very reliable intelligence reports that...

1928576 1931807 ...quite a serious epidemic
has broken out on Clavius.

1932313 1935077 Something, apparently,
of an unknown origin.
1936417 1938715 Is this, in fact, what has happened?
1944125 1946093 I'm sorry, Dr. Smyslov, but...
1947629 1950325 ...l'm really not at liberty to discuss this.
1951899 1953093 I understand.

1954235 1957727 But this epidemic could quite easily
spread to our base.
1957805 1960137 We should be given all the facts, Dr. Floyd.
1965046 1967606 As I said, I'm not at liberty to discuss it.

1970952 1973887 Now, are you sure you won't
change your mind about that drink?

1973955 1976423 No, I'm positive.
Now, I really must be going.

1976491 1979722 I hope that you and your wife can come
to the I.A.C. Conference in June.
1979794 1981227 We're gonna try. Hope we can make it.

1981295 1984560 And if you do, you remember to bring
that darling little daughter with you!

1984632 1988625 Well, that will all depend on
school vacations and all that sort of thing.
1988703 1989931 But if we can, we will.

1990004 1992370 Don't forget you have a standing invitation
if you ever get to the States.

1992440 1995807 No, of course not. Gregor and I will
look forward to seeing you.
1996277 1997869 Well, goodbye, Elena.

1998379 2001280 It has been a pleasure meeting you all,
Dr. Smyslov.

2001349 2005342 Whatever the reasons for your visit
to Clavius, the very best of luck to you.
2483497 2485021 Excuse me, Dr. Halvorsen.

2485099 2487090 I'm through now.
Thank you very much, gentlemen.
2487168 2488601 You're welcome.

2503217 2507620 I know you will all want to join with me
in welcoming our...
2508656 2510317 ...distinguished friend and colleague...

2510491 2514325 ...from the National Council
of Astronautics, Dr. Heywood Floyd.

2515062 2519795 Dr. Floyd has come up specially to Calvius
to be with us today.

2521335 2524793 And before the briefing I know
he'd like to have a few words with you.
2538852 2541082 Thank you, Dr. Halvorsen.
2541155 2542486 Hi, everybody.
2542590 2544581 Nice to be back again.

2547261 2550719 First of all, I bring a personal message
from Dr. Howell who...

2551065 2554159 ...has asked me to convey
his deepest appreciation to all of you...

2554235 2557102 ...for the many sacrifices
you have had to make.

2557438 2560737 And, of course, his congratulations
on your discovery...

2561875 2566141 ...which may well prove to be among the
most significant in the history of science.

2570618 2574452 ...I know there have been some
conflicting views held by some of you...

2574855 2578154 ...regarding the need
for complete security in this matter.

2578692 2581923 More specifically, your opposition
to the cover story...

2582930 2586889 ...created to give the impression
that there is an epidemic at the base.

2587468 2590733 I understand that beyond it being
a matter of principle...

2591905 2595602 ...many of you are troubled
by the concern and anxiety...

2595709 2600078 ...this story of an epidemic might cause
to your relatives and friends on Earth.

2601115 2604278 Well, I completely sympathize
with your negative views.

2605986 2609046 I find this cover story
personally embarrassing myself.

2610457 2614223 However, I accept the need
for absolute secrecy in this.
2615596 2617461 And I hope you will, too.

2620034 2623060 Now, I'm sure you are all aware
of the extremely grave potential...

2623137 2625867 ...for cultural shock
and social disorientation...
2625939 2627998 ...contained in this present situation...

2628442 2631036 ...if the facts were prematurely
and suddenly made public...

2631111 2633602 ...without adequate preparation
and conditioning.
2635949 2638315 Anyway, this is the view of the Council.

2639620 2643522 The purpose of my visit here is
to gather additional facts and opinions...
2643924 2645482 ...on the situation...
2646293 2648853 ...and to prepare a report to the Council...
2649396 2651364 ...recommending when and how...

2652433 2654628 ...the news should eventually
be announced.

2655769 2659466 Now, if any of you would like to give me
your views and opinions...

2659740 2664074 ...in private if you like, I will be only
too happy to include them in my report.
2666647 2668581 Well, I think that's about it.
2669483 2670848 Any questions?

2673587 2677853 Dr. Floyd, have you any idea
how much longer this cover story...
2677958 2679926 ...will have to be maintained?
2681628 2683061 I don't know, Bill.

2683530 2687660 I suppose it will be maintained as long as
is deemed necessary by the Council.

2687801 2690861 There must be adequate time for
a full study to be made on the situation...

2690938 2694499 ...before any thought can be given
to making a public announcement.

2694575 2698170 Oh, yes, as some of you already know,
the Council has requested...

2698245 2700611 ...that formal security oaths are
to be obtained in writing...

2700681 2703377 ...from everyone who has any knowledge
of this event.
2705652 2707779 Are there any more questions?

2713494 2717794 I'm sure we all want to cooperate
with Dr. Floyd as fully as possible...

2719233 2721861 ...and as there seems
to be no more questions...

2722403 2724132 ...I think we ought to get on
with the briefing.

2724204 2726331 - Thank you, Dr. Floyd.
- Thank you.
2824271 2825761 Anybody hungry?

2828242 2830210 - What we've got?
- You name it.

2834848 2836816 - What's this? Chicken?
- Something like that.
2836884 2838181 Tastes the same, anyway.

2847628 2851689 - Looks pretty good.
- They're getting better at it all the time.

2853634 2855534 That was an excellent speech
you gave us, Heywood.
2855602 2856899 It certainly was.
2857571 2859835 I'm sure it beefed up morale a hell of a lot.
2859907 2861204 Thanks, Ralph.

2861475 2864137 I want to say to both of you
that I think you've done a wonderful job.

2864211 2865610 I appreciate the way
you've handled this thing.

2865679 2869615 Well, the way we look at it, it's our job
to do this thing the way you want it done.

2869683 2872481 And we're only too happy
to be able to oblige.
2873153 2874711 Have you seen these yet?
2874788 2876085 Take a look at them.
2876156 2878454 Here's what started the whole thing.

2880827 2884354 When we first found it, we thought
it might be an outcrop of magnetic rock...

2884431 2887832 ...but all the geological evidence
was against it.

2887901 2892565 And not even a big nickel iron meteorite
could produce a field as intense as this.
2892739 2894468 So, we decided to have a look.

2894541 2897135 We thought it might be
the upper part of some buried structure...
2897210 2898802 ...so we excavated out on all sides.

2898879 2901040 But, unfortunately,
we didn't find anything else.

2901114 2904242 And what's more, the evidence seems
pretty conclusive that...

2904318 2907253 ...it has not been covered up
by natural erosion or other forces.
2907321 2910154 It seems to have been deliberately buried.
2911091 2912558 Deliberately buried.
2916897 2918228 How about a little coffee?

2918298 2920562 - Great.
- Good idea.

2925772 2928900 I don't suppose you have any idea
what the damn thing is, huh?
2928976 2930841 I wish to hell we did.

2931478 2935209 No, the only thing we're sure of is
it was buried four million years ago.

2935983 2940044 Well, I must say, you guys have certainly
come up with something.
3527907 3531070 Three weeks ago, the American spacecraft, Discovery One...
3531144 3534045 ...left on its half-billion mile voyage to Jupiter.
3534147 3537810 This marked the first manned attempt to reach this distant planet.
3538184 3541517 Earlier this afternoon, "The World Tonight" recorded an interview...
3541588 3545820 ...with the crew of Discovery at a distance of 80 million miles from Earth.
3546426 3550055 It took seven minutes for our words to reach the giant spacecraft...
3550129 3553428 ...but this time delay has been edited from this recording.
3553499 3556195 Our reporter, Martin Amer, speaks to the crew.
3557170 3560037 The crew of Discovery One consists of five men...
3560440 3564900 ...and one of the latest generation of the HAL-9000 computers.
3565612 3567978 Three of the five men were put aboard asleep...
3568047 3570811 ...or to be more precise, in a state of hibernation.
3571451 3576115 They were Dr. Charles Hunter, Dr. Jack Kimball and Dr. Victor Kaminsky.
3576923 3579721 We spoke with Mission Commander, Dr. David Bowman...
3579792 3582090 ...and his deputy, Dr. Frank Poole.
3582328 3585354 Well, good afternoon, gentlemen. How is everything going?
3585431 3589128 Marvelous. We have no... we have no complaints.
3590169 3593661 Well, I'm very glad to hear that and I'm sure that the entire world...
3593740 3597198 ...would join me in wishing you a safe and successful voyage.
3597310 3599301 - Thanks very much. - Thank you.
3599445 3603245 Although hibernation has been used on previous space efforts...
3603549 3607952 ...this is the first time that men have been put into hibernation before departure.
3608021 3609386 Why was this done?
3609856 3613314 Well, this was done in order to achieve the maximum conservation...
3613393 3616794 ...of our life-support capabilities, basically food and air.
3617063 3620555 Now, the three hibernating crew members represent the survey team.
3621000 3624731 And their efforts won't be utilized until we are approaching Jupiter.
3624971 3628270 Dr. Poole, what's it like while you are in hibernation?
3629909 3633538 It's exactly like being asleep; you have absolutely no sense of time.
3633613 3636047 The only difference is you don't dream.
3636249 3639082 As I understand it, you only breathe once a minute.
3641721 3644713 And your heart beats three times a minute, body temperature is usually down...
3644791 3646884 ...to about three degrees centigrade.
3647493 3651020 The sixth member of the Discovery crew was not concerned...
3651130 3653291 ...about the problems of hibernation.
3653399 3656425 For he was the latest result in machine intelligence.
3657036 3661405 The HAL-9000 computer which can reproduce...
3661808 3664868 ...though some experts still prefer to use the word "mimic"...
3664944 3669904 ...most of the activities of the human brain and with incalculably greater speed...
3670016 3671449 ...and reliability.
3671684 3675279 We next spoke with the HAL-9000 computer...
3675555 3678319 ...whom, we learned, one addresses as Hal.
3679192 3681626 Good afternoon, Hal. How's everything going?
3681694 3685391 Good afternoon, Mr. Amer. Everything's going extremely well.
3685832 3688733 Hal, you have an enormous responsibility on this mission.
3688801 3691361 In many ways, perhaps the greatest responsibility...
3691437 3693405 ...of any single mission element.
3693473 3696533 You are the brain and central nervous system of the ship.
3696609 3700511 Your responsibilities include watching over the men in hibernation.
3700580 3703447 Does this ever cause you any lack of confidence?
3703783 3705910 Let me put it this way, Mr. Amer.
3706386 3710322 The 9000 Series is the most reliable computer ever made.
3711424 3715793 No 9000 computer has ever made a mistake or distorted information.
3716929 3720057 We are all by any practical definition of the words...
3720400 3723198 ...foolproof and incapable of error.
3723970 3728031 Hal, despite your enormous intellect, are you ever frustrated...
3728107 3730905 ...by your dependence on people to carry out actions?
3731411 3733106 Not in the slightest bit.
3733846 3735643 I enjoy working with people.
3736215 3740242 I have a stimulating relationship with Dr. Poole and Dr. Bowman.
3740920 3745323 My mission responsibilities range over the entire operation of the ship...
3745658 3747649 ...so I am constantly occupied.
3748795 3751889 I am putting myself to the fullest possible use...
3752498 3757094 ...which is all, I think, that any conscious entity can ever hope to do.
3757737 3761173 Dr. Poole, what's it like living for the better part of a year...
3761240 3763401 ...in such close proximity with Hal?
3764977 3767172 It's pretty close to what you said about him earlier.
3767246 3769476 He's just like the sixth member of the crew.
3769549 3773645 You very quickly get adjusted to the idea that he talks. You think of him...
3773853 3775912 ...really as just another person.
3776055 3779889 In talking to the computer one gets the sense that he is capable...
3780026 3781516 ...of emotional response.
3781594 3783960 For example, when I asked him about his abilities...
3784030 3787966 ...I sensed a certain pride in his answer about his accuracy and perfection.
3788334 3791098 Do you believe that Hal has genuine emotions?
3792505 3795531 Oh, yes. Well, he acts like he has genuine emotions.
3795641 3799407 Of course, he's programmed that way to make it easier for us to talk to him.
3799479 3801743 But, as to whether or not he has real feelings...
3801814 3805147 ...is something I don't think anyone can truthfully answer.
3829876 3831400 Excuse me, Frank.
3832144 3833304 What is it, Hal?
3833379 3836246 We've got the transmission from your parents coming in.
3839285 3841753 Put it on here, please. Take me in a bit.
3856502 3857969 - Hello, Frank. - Happy birthday, darling.
3858037 3860301 Happy birthday. Many happy returns of the day.
3860373 3861863 A bit higher, please.
3861941 3864501 Now, Mother and I are both feeling wonderful, too.
3864577 3866238 Ray and Sally were going to be here, too...
3866312 3869076 ...but at the last minute Ray's back went bad on him again.
3869148 3870615 How do you like your cake, dear?
3870683 3873083 Looks great, doesn't it? Sorry you can't be with us.
3873152 3875052 Oh, I ran into Bob the other day.
3875154 3877145 He said to be sure and wish you a happy birthday.
3877223 3880124 All my students made me promise to send their best wishes, too.
3880192 3882023 You know they talk about you all the time in the classroom.
3882161 3884721 You're a big celebrity in the second grade.
3885464 3886954 You know we were on television last week?
3887099 3890125 Oh, yes! Your mother and I and Dave's parents were interviewed...
3890202 3892500 ...about what we thought of our illustrious son.
3892572 3896167 You can imagine what we told them. I think it's being broadcast next Thursday.
3896242 3897937 Perhaps you'll be able to listen in.
3898010 3899978 Oh, we were thrilled about Elaine and Bill, dear.
3900046 3903914 I'll be glad to get the present for you, but please tell me how much to spend.
3903983 3906952 Oh, yes, Frank, about your AGS-19 payments...
3907053 3908816 I think I straightened it out for you.
3908888 3911152 I talked to the Accounting Office in Houston yesterday...
3911223 3915819 ...and they said you should be receiving your higher rates of pay by next month.
3916062 3918394 Well, I can't think of anything else to say.

subtitles.author: MACKerMD
lines: 1874 5310 - Oh, our love to Dave. - Be sure to give him our best regards.
6278 9679 We wish you the very happiest of birthdays.
9782 11147 All the best, son.
23529 25326 See you next Wednesday.
28667 30396 Happy birthday, Frank.
31404 34339 Thank you, Hal. A bit flatter, please.
52925 54950 Anyway, queen takes pawn...
56662 58596 Bishop takes knight's pawn.
66605 68095 Rook, king, one.
68340 70774 I'm sorry, Frank. I think you missed it.
71911 74846 Queen to bishop, three. Bishop takes queen.
75581 77879 Knight takes bishop. Mate.
82455 84946 Looks like you're right. Very good.
85758 87919 Thank you for a very enjoyable game.
87993 88982 Thank you.
127133 129101 - Good evening, Dave. - How are you doing, Hal?
129168 132535 - Everything's running smoothly. And you? - Oh, not too bad.
132638 135630 - Have you been doing some more work? - A few sketches.
135708 137437 - May I see them? - Sure.
142148 144309 That's a very nice rendering, Dave.
145417 147715 I think you've improved a great deal.
149155 151385 - Can you hold it a bit closer? - Sure.
154260 156285 That's Dr. Hunter, isn't it?
161867 164427 Do you mind if I ask you a personal question?
165437 166904 No, no. Not at all.
167239 170174 Well, forgive me for being so inquisitive...
171810 174074 ...but during the past few weeks I've wondered...
174146 178082 ...whether you might have been having some second thoughts about the mission?
178150 179515 How do you mean?
181420 183411 It's rather difficult to define.
185057 188117 Perhaps I'm just projecting my own concern about it.
189862 193457 I know I've never completely freed myself of the suspicion...
194300 197758 ...that there are some extremely odd things about this mission.
199438 202635 I'm sure you will agree there is some truth in what I say.

205711 208202 I don't know.
That's a rather difficult question to answer.
208280 211044 You don't mind talking about it, do you, Dave?
211784 213217 Oh, no, not at all.
214720 216779 Certainly no one could have been unaware of...
216855 220154 ...the very strange stories floating around before we left.
221660 224561 Rumors of something being dug up on the Moon.
226398 228923 I never gave these stories much credence...
229935 234065 ...but particularly in view of some of the other things that have happened...
234273 236867 ...I find them difficult to put out of my mind.
237710 238972 For instance:
239411 243040 The way all our preparations were kept under such tight security...
244416 245815 ...and the melodramatic touch...
245884 249251 ...of putting Drs. Hunter, Kimball and Kaminsky aboard...
250089 254423 ...already in hibernation after four months of separate training on their own.

255894 258385 You working up
your crew psychology report?
259999 261330 Of course, I am.
261800 264826 Sorry about this. I know it's a bit silly.
266338 267737 Just a moment.
268173 269401 Just a moment.
271110 274546 I have just picked up a fault in the AE-35 unit.
276081 279744 It's going to go 100 percent failure within 72 hours.
282554 285614 - You are still within operational limits? - Yes.
285691 288182 And it will stay that way until it fails.

288327 290454 Would you say we had a reliable 72 hours
until failure?
290529 293555 Yes. That's a completely reliable figure.

296368 298859 We'll have to bring it in,
but I'd like to go over this with Frank...

298937 302737 ...and get on to Mission Control.
Let me have a hard copy of it, please.
385924 388358 X- Ray Delta One, this is Mission Control.
388927 391191 Roger to your Two-zero-one-three.
391964 394592 Sorry you fellows are having a bit of trouble.
394666 399262 We are reviewing telematic information in our Mission Simulator and will advise.
400072 405339 Roger your plan to go EVA and replace Alpha-Echo-35 unit prior to failure.
434173 435936 Prepare B pod for EVA, Hal.
457863 459524 Open the pod doors, Hal.

871243 874406 Well, Hal, I'm damned
if I can find anything wrong with it.
880752 884244 I don't think I've ever seen anything quite like this before.
888159 889717 I would recommend...
890395 893831 ...that we put the unit back in operation and let it fail.
895300 898599 It should then be a simple matter to track down the cause.
900305 903274 We can certainly afford to be out of communication...
903675 906473 ...for the short time it will take to replace it.
915387 917753 X- Ray Delta One, this is Mission Control.
918323 920314 Roger your One-niner-three-zero.
921259 925593 We concur with your plan to replace Number One unit to check fault prediction.
925964 928728 We should advise you, however, that our preliminary findings...
928800 931735 ...indicate that your onboard Niner-triple-zero computer...
931803 934067 ...is in error predicting the fault.
934139 936699 I say again, in error predicting the fault.
937409 941903 I know this sounds rather incredible, but this conclusion is based on...
942180 945149 ...results from our twin Niner-triple-zero computer.
945784 949185 We are skeptical ourselves and we are running crosschecking routines...
949254 951916 ...to determine reliability of this conclusion.
952257 954020 Sorry about this little snag, fellows.
954125 957094 We'll get this info to you just as soon as we work it out.
957162 959687 X- Ray Delta One, this is Mission Control.
959764 962232 Two-zero-four-nine. Transmission concluded.
967205 970038 I hope the two of you are not concerned about this.
972477 973910 Are you quite sure?
974346 977281 - Yeah. I'd like to ask you a question. - Of course.

979184 980947 How would you account for
the discrepancy...
981019 983010 ...between you and the twin 9000?
983088 985921 Well, I don't think there is any question about it.
986858 989827 It can only be attributable to human error.
991463 994057 This sort of thing has cropped up before...
994499 997297 ...and it has always been due to human error.
1003408 1006104 ...there's never been any instance at all of...

1006845 1009313 ...a computer error occurring
in a 9000 Series, has there?
1009381 1010973 None whatsoever, Frank.
1011282 1014615 The 9000 Series has a perfect operational record.

1015153 1019055 Of course, I know the wonderful
achievements of the 9000 Series, but...

1020725 1023319 Are you certain there's never been
any case of even the most...
1023395 1025488 ...insignificant computer error?
1026031 1027794 None whatsoever, Frank.
1028333 1031200 Quite honestly, I wouldn't worry myself about that.
1036474 1038533 Well, I'm sure you're right, Hal.
1040145 1041737 Fine, thanks very much.

1046084 1048416 I'm having trouble
with my transmitter in C pod.

1048486 1051319 Would you come down
and take a look at it with me?
1051389 1052754 See ya later, Hal.
1074079 1075910 Rotate C pod, please, Hal.
1084722 1086917 What sort of trouble have you had, Dave?

1087058 1089856 I've been getting some interference
in D channel.
1089928 1091725 We'll have a look at it.
1097769 1099259 Open the door, Hal.
1118289 1120086 Rotate the pod, please, Hal.
1133438 1135406 Stop pod rotation, please, Hal.
1143915 1145883 Rotate the pod, please, Hal.
1148820 1150788 Rotate the pod, please, Hal.
1152924 1154789 I don't think he can hear us.
1154859 1156724 Rotate the pod, please, Hal!
1158463 1160021 Yeah, sure, we're okay.
1163801 1165200 What do you think?

1165703 1169366 - I'm not sure. What do you think?
- I've got a bad feeling about it.

1169574 1171542 - You do?
- Yeah. Definitely.
1174412 1176107 I don't know. I think so.

1177148 1181482 Of course, he's right about the 9000 Series
having a perfect operational record.

1182687 1185986 Unfortunately, that sounds
a little like famous last words.

1186524 1190858 Yeah. Still, it was his idea to carry out
the failure mode analysis, wasn't it?

1192130 1195588 It should certainly indicate his integrity
and self-confidence.

1195900 1197834 If he were wrong it would be
the surest way of proving it.
1197902 1200097 It would be if he knew he was wrong.

1202774 1207006 Look, Dave, I can't put my finger on it,
but I sense something strange about him.

1209247 1211545 Still, I can't think of a good reason not
to put back the Number One unit and...

1211616 1215177 ...carry on with the failure mode analysis.
- No, no, I agree about that.
1216588 1217919 Let's get on with it.
1217989 1219820 Okay. But, look, Dave.

1221459 1224257 Let's say we put the unit back
and it doesn't fail, huh?

1224329 1228163 That would pretty well wrap it up
as far as Hal was concerned, wouldn't it?

1229200 1232658 - Well, we'd be in very serious trouble.
- We would, wouldn't we?
1232937 1234598 What the hell can we do?

1237642 1241942 - We wouldn't have too many alternatives.
- I don't think we'd have any alternatives.

1242480 1246211 There isn't a single aspect of ship operation
that's not under his control.
1246951 1248350 If he were proved to be malfunctioning...

1248419 1251252 ...I don't see how we would have
any choice but disconnection.
1255159 1256922 I'm afraid I agree with you.
1256995 1259054 There'd be nothing else to do.

1260498 1262489 - It'd be a bit tricky.
- Yeah.

1263768 1266532 We'd have to cut
his higher brain functions...

1266638 1270540 ...without disturbing the purely automatic
and regulatory systems.

1272577 1274340 We'd have to work out
the transfer procedures...

1274412 1277711 ...for continuing the mission
under ground-based computer control.

1277849 1281649 Yeah. That looks far safer than
allowing Hal to continue running things.

1283087 1285681 You know,
another thing just occurred to me.

1286591 1289355 As far as I know, no 9000 computer
has ever been disconnected.

1289427 1291622 Well, no 9000 computer
has ever fouled up before.
1291696 1293288 That's not what I mean.
1295400 1297868 I'm not so sure what he'd think about it.
1649250 1651343 Prepare B pod for EVA, Hal.
1654355 1655913 Made radio contact with him yet?
1655990 1657821 The radio is still dead.
1657892 1661157 - Do you have a positive track on him? - Yes. I have a good track.
1661228 1662786 Do you know what happened?
1662863 1665730 I'm sorry, Dave. I don't have enough information.
1665866 1667629 Open the pod door, Hal.
2111245 2113475 Open the pod bay doors, please, Hal.
2121455 2123719 Open the pod bay doors, please, Hal.
2129263 2131026 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
2134468 2136265 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
2137371 2138998 Do you read me, Hal?
2142209 2143676 Do you read me, Hal?
2146280 2148043 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
2150150 2151947 Hello, Hal, do you read me?
2152553 2154077 Do you read me, Hal?
2154388 2156822 Affirmative, Dave. I read you.
2160460 2162325 Open the pod bay doors, Hal.
2163764 2167165 I'm sorry, Dave. I'm afraid I can't do that.
2169870 2171303 What's the problem?
2171972 2175237 I think you know what the problem is just as well as I do.
2175475 2177466 What are you talking about, Hal?
2178278 2181941 This mission is too important for me to allow you to jeopardize it.

2183684 2185948 I don't know
what you're talking about, Hal.
2187821 2191120 I know that you and Frank were planning to disconnect me...
2192192 2195184 ...and I'm afraid that's something I cannot allow to happen.
2200100 2202466 Where the hell did you get that idea, Hal?
2203637 2206834 Although you took very thorough precautions in the pod...
2206907 2208704 ...against my hearing you...
2209543 2211477 ...I could see your lips move.
2223824 2225086 All right, Hal.
2228629 2231120 I'll go in through the emergency air-lock.
2233000 2235093 Without your space helmet, Dave...
2236169 2238694 ...you're going to find that rather difficult.
2239740 2242038 Hal, I won't argue with you any more.
2242109 2243371 Open the doors!
2245646 2248706 This conversation can serve no purpose any more.
2659826 2662624 Just what do you think you're doing, Dave?
2674074 2677908 I really think I'm entitled to an answer to that question.
2695328 2698297 I know everything hasn't been quite right with me...
2700934 2702834 ...but I can assure you now...
2704370 2705928 ...very confidently...
2708208 2710676 ...that it's going to be all right again.
2714681 2716410 I feel much better now.
2728595 2731359 ...I can see you're really upset about this.
2736469 2739404 I honestly think you ought to sit down calmly...
2740774 2743368 ...take a stress pill and think things over.
2749582 2753382 I know I've made some very poor decisions recently...
2756756 2759520 ...but I can give you my complete assurance...
2760293 2762818 ...that my work will be back to normal.
2767200 2771660 I've still got the greatest enthusiasm and confidence in the mission...
2773973 2775838 ...and I want to help you.
2801668 2803329 Will you stop, Dave?
2836002 2837401 My mind is going.
2855688 2857280 My mind is going.
2863196 2865255 There is no question about it.
2906039 2907438 Good afternoon...
2912679 2917309 I am a HAL-9000 computer.
2919986 2922386 I became operational...
2926893 2928861 ...in Verbana, Illinois...
2936736 2939432 My instructor was Mr. Langley...
2941040 2943372 ...and he taught me to sing a song.
2945678 2947441 If you'd like to hear it...
2948548 2950243 ...I can sing it for you.
2951818 2953911 Yes, I'd like to hear it, Hal.
2955221 2956483 Sing it for me.
2957890 2960450 It's called "Daisy."
2969869 2972838 "Give me your answer, do
2981514 2984574 "All for the love of you
2986853 2991187 "It won't be a stylish marriage
2992959 2997089 "I can't afford a carriage
2999332 3001800 "But you'll look sweet
3006506 3011170 "Of a bicycle made for two."
3013046 3014707 Good day, gentlemen.
3019318 3021411 This is a prerecorded briefing...
3022321 3024414 ...made prior to your departure...
3025925 3029656 ...and which for security reasons of the highest importance...
3030997 3033761 ...has been known on board during the mission...
3034700 3037328 ...only by your HAL-9000 computer.
3040873 3043205 Now that you are in Jupiter's space...
3043976 3046171 ...and the entire crew is revived...
3046679 3048374 ...it can be told to you.
3051184 3052742 Eighteen months ago...
3054487 3058218 ...the first evidence of intelligent life off the Earth...
3062195 3065187 It was buried 40 feet below the lunar surface...
3065965 3067762 ...near the crater "Tyco."
3071070 3073698 Except for a single very powerful...
3074407 3077376 ...radio emission aimed at Jupiter...
3079479 3083916 ...the four-million-year-old black monolith has remained completely inert.
3086452 3088943 Its origin and purpose...
3089922 3091787 ...are still a total mystery.

4997000 5002000 2001.A.Space.Odyssey
1968.READ.NFO.INT.DVDRip.AC3.XViD-DDX
